Iheanacho and Ndidi win FA Cup as Leicester City beat Chelsea for final
Two nigerians, Kelechi Iheanacho and Wilfred Ndidi don be FA Cup winners afta dem help Leicester City beat Chelsea 1-0 for di FA Cup final wey dem play on Saturday.
Na Leicester City
first ever FA Cup for di club 137-year old history.
Youri Tieleman amazing strike for di front of 22,000 fans for Wembley na im be di difference between di two teams.
Di largest sport event crowd for England since wey di coronavirus pandemic start 14 months ago enjoy a goal wey fit to win any trophy as di Belgian midfielder shoot inside di top corner for 63 minutes.
Kasper Schmeichel show one amazing save wey deny Mason Mount a goal, and Chelsea sef get one goal wey VAR cancel as offside.
Five years afta Foxes shock di Premier League giants to become champions, Leicester don finally claim di English football oda prestigious trophy di fifth time since dem don dey try.
Dem don lose di final four times, but di last one wey dem lose na 52 years ago.
Di historic week fit even get beta for Brendan Rodgers players, as dem dey close to qualifying for next Champions League season.
Di sides go meet again in three days time for Stamford Bridge to decide who go secure di top-four finish for di Premier League.
Chelsea go need a quick comeback afta dem lose for di fourth time in 27 games since Thomas Tuchel replace Frank Lampard wey dem sack for January.
Di Blues also get Champions League final wey dem dey prepare for against Manchester City in two weeks time, but dem fit end di campaign witout trophy or place for Europe premier club competition next season.
Chelsea success under Tuchel don kom, sake of dia beta defensive record, but dia struggle for  di oda end don show again.
Tuchel men dominate befor first-half but dem struggle to create straightforward chances even afta Leicester defensive lynchpin Jonny Evans carry injury for di middle of di first half.
Wayward Werner Timo Werner
wayward finishing has characterised his first season in England since joining from RB Leipzig for 47 million ($66 million) and the German international had another day to forget in front of goal.
Tuchel turned away in disgust after Werner blazed high and wide from the edge of the box with the Leicester defence stretched midway through the first half.
Werner then came closest to breaking the deadlock before half-time as his header drifted just wide and evaded Cesar Azpilicueta as the Chelsea captain launched himself in at the far post.
The welcome return of noise echoing down from 6,000 fans of each side from both ends of the ground helped mask a general lack of quality on the field.
Another 10,000 local supporters, key workers and Football Association stakeholders were also in attendance as Wembley gears up for hosting matches at Euro 2020 next month at 25 percent capacity.
One moment of magic proved decisive as Tielemans collected possession midway inside the Chelsea half and strode forward before unleashing an unstoppable strike into the top corner past Kepa Arrizabalaga.
Tuchel flexed the strength in depth of his squad in an attempt to find an equaliser as Callum Hudson-Odoi, Ben Chilwell, Kai Havertz, Olivier Giroud and Christian Pulisic were all introduced off the bench.
But they were denied by the brilliance of Schmeichel in the Leicester goal.
Chilwell, whose every touch was booed by the Leicester supporters, nearly came back to haunt his old club as his header was turned onto the post by the Dane.
Mount then could not believe his luck as his sweetly struck shot was turned behind by a brilliant stop from Schmeichel.
Even when the Leicester keeper was beaten, Chelsea were denied by a VAR review.
A Wes Morgan own goal looked set to send the game to extra-time, but Chilwell had strayed offside in the build-up.
Leicester players and fans celebrate di decision like a goal and were in raptures again moments later after seeing out a nervy finale.
Tinubu, govs, oda S/West leaders reject secession
Inside di agitation for Oduduwa Republic for South-West, leaders of di All Progressives Congress (APC) for di geo-political zone meet for Lagos on Sunday, and dem show dia strong opposition to di agitation.
Di meetin wey hold for Lagos House, Marina, na base on di call of di former interim National Chairman of di APC, Chief Bisi Akande.
Dose wey dey di meetin na national leader of di APC, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, governor of Lagos, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State, Adegboyega Oyetola of Osun and Chief Bisi Akande.
Odas wey follow dey di meetin na General Alani Akinrinade (rtd), former governor of Ogun State, Prince Segun Osoba, Minista of Industry, Trade and Investment, Otunba Niyi Adebayo and Chief Pius Akinyelure wit odas.
Daily Trust hear say di meetin na in response to di raging agitation for Yoruba nation by some pipo for di region, wit different rally wey dem don hold for South-West states to agitate for Oduduwa Republic.
Inside one statement wey Chief Akande read, di South West leaders tell security agencies and di federal government say make dem reduce tension for di kontri afta di worsenin security challenges wey dey torment di nation.
Na part of wetin dey di statement be dis; We note wit significant concern di security situation for di kontri.
Terrorism and violent criminality dey threaten many areas, badly affecting di live and livelihood of plenti innocent and peace-loving Nigerians.
We encourage di federal government to kontinue to make di necessary expenditure and allocate sufficient resources wey go enable di military and security agencies tackle di hard security challenges wey dey face us.
For Nigeria to overcome dis challenges, we need do so wit unity of purpose and action.
Di desire for peace and di chance for a prosperous and just society dey universal and e pass all form of regional, religious or ethnic division.
Sadly, many public figure don tok tins wey fit cause division and destroy di unity of purpose wey we need.
We dey restate awa extreme dislike of violence as a means to achieve either politikal or economic power and influence.
We strongly condemn any form of violence for any part of di kontri, regardless of where di victims or pipo wey cause di violence kom from. 
Government need do evritin wey e fit do to protect potential victims and to help dose wey don be victims of terrorism or widespread banditry befor.
We support wetin di Southern Governors tok about ranching for dia May 11, 2021 summit wey happun for Asaba, Delta State.
We support becos dat kind decision go fit reduce di tension between farmers and herdsmen, and e go also help di long-term economic development of di farming and herding communities togeda.
2023: INEC don verify voting points for conversion to polling units
Di Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) on Tuesday begin a nationwide verification exercise of di voting points (VPs) wey dem propose say dem wan convert to pollin units (PUs) tru-out di kontri.
INEC Chairman, Prof. Mahmood Yakubu na im tok am on Tuesday for Abuja, wen e visit som of di centres wey dem wan use and som current PUs for di FCT and Nasarawa State.
Prof. Yakubu, wen e dey follow tori-men yarn for di commission Local Government office wey dey Karu, Nasarawa State, tok say di purpose of di verification na to make sure say dem do di right tin befor dem convert di VPs to PUs.
E tok say; All di national commissioners don kommot, dem dey visit di states of di federation so dem go fit verify di work of convertin di voting points to polling units.
Meanwhile, di commission tok am yesterday say dem don upgrade 956 voting points to polling units for Sokoto State.
A guide to soya bean farming as planting go begin by June
Soya na plant wey dem dey grow, mostly becos of e beans wey dem fit use do different tins.
Na legume wey get high nutritious value.
Awa agric editor wey don dey monitor di soya bean value-chain tok say, even say dem know Nigeria as di largest producer of soya for Afrika, di production level still neva reach im full capacity.
Dis na becos most of dose wey dey plant soya bean for di kontri be small farmers. Dem no dey plant am as di main crop, but dem dey use am support oda major crops like corn, cowpea (beans) and cassava.
Som soya bean farmers wey follow Daily Trust yarn believe say wit small agricultural tools and effort, we fit grow di crop for many states for Nigeria.
Di reason why more farmers suppose enta soya bean farming
Mallam Yinusa Jimoh, wey be Ilorin-based retired agric extension officer, tell Daily Trust for fone say apart from di domestic and economical values wey soya bean get, e dey also improve soil fertility and dem fit use am kontrol striga.
E tok say di market for soya bean dey grow fast for Nigeria, and opportunity dey for farmers to improve dia income.
One handbook wey di International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) produce on soya bean show say di fast growth for poultry sector during di past five years don also increase di demand for soya bean meal for Nigeria.
The IITA handbook reads in part: It is also a prime source of vegetable oil in the international market.
Soya bean get average protein content of 40 percent and e get more protein pass any of di common vegetable or animal food source wey dey for Nigeria.
Accordin to IITA, SALMA Oil Mills for Kano, Grand Cereals for Jos, ECWA Feeds for Jos, AFCOT Oil Seed Processors for Adamawa and PS Mandrides wey dey Kano dey all process soya bean.
Wetin dis one mean be say ready market dey for farmers wey get interest for soya farming for di kontri.
Right now, for di local market, one de-rica of soya bean na N600; dependin on di area, while dem dey sell 50kg bag for around N17,000.
Di global demand for di crop na about 11 million tonnes, while di yearly amount of soya bean wey dem dey chop for Afrika na about 619 thousand tonnes.
Di best way wey we fit take use farm soya bean
Accordin to a long time soya bean farmer, Dr Awoniyi Joseph, soya bean planting dey always start for June, and e dey grow well on all type of soil, except deep soil wey no fit hold water.
Dr Joseph yarn farmers say one important tin to consider wen pesin wan start soya bean farming for Nigeria na rainfall.
E tok say Nigeria get very gud climate wey dey perfect for soya bean to flourish.
As Awoniyi tok, gud harvest depend mostly on regular irrigation, becosthroughirrigation, di crop fit grow for areas wey no get plenti rainfall.
Accordin to IITA, make dem no plant soya bean for sandy, gravelly, or shallow soils to prevent drought stress, dem advise say make dem no plant am for soil wey get plenty water or soil wit surfaces wey fit break, cos dis no go make di seed komot well. 
Clear all di plants wey dey, befor u prepare di land.
U fit prepare di seedbed manually wit a hoe or animal-drawn equipment or tractor, IITA advise.
Land wey dem prepare well dey allow di seed germinate well, and e dey reduce weed infestation.
IITA add am join say; U fit plant on ridges or on flat seedbed.
Experts don warn say to choose di type of soya bean wey u go plant, u need look at di period wey e dey take mature, di yield potential, lodging, and how well e fit tolerate drought and resist pest and disease.
John Stephen, wey be soya bean farmer for Garam, one community for Niger State, close to di FCT, insist say na di maturity period u need to consida first wen u wan choose di type of soya bean wey fit ur location.
Stephen advise say, for areas wey get low rainfall, make u consida di seed wey dey mature early rada dan di one wey dey mature late.
Although seed wey dey mature late dey always get beta yield, but e dey risky to plant late maturing seed for dry environments becos of late season drought.
IITA advise farmers say make di type of seed wey dem go choose be of high quality becos soya bean seeds dey quick lose dia viability.
According to di institute, e dey common for soya bean not to grow afta 12 to 15 monts wey e don dey for storage, even wen dem keep am well.
So, make u use seed wey never pass 12 monts so e go fit germinate well.
Select di gud seed komot for planting so u go fit make sure say dem no get insect, disease, or weed seeds.
Make u no buy seed from open market, cos di ability for di seed to germinate no guarantee.
Planting seed wey get poor quality no go produce beta yield.
Di institute advise for di handbook.
Conducting germination test 
If e dey possible, IITA recommend say make u test di seed befor planting.
Di institute recommend say make di germination rate be 85 percent or more to get gud stand.
Accordin to IITA, to conduct a quick seed germination test, make u select 400 seeds randomly, den plant 100 seeds each for four woodin or plastik boxes or seedbed wey u don prepare.
Plant one seed per hole wit a distance of 10cm between di seeds.
Soak di woodin or plastik boxes or di seedbed well wit water befor planting and make u dey put water evri mornin and evenin.
Begin dey count di seedlings five days afta planting and complete di counting within 10 days.
If u fit count a total of 320 seeds wey germinate, e mean say di germination rate of di seed na 80 percent and above.
Wen di percentage of germination na 80 percent or less, u go need increase di seed rate to achieve 100 percent.
Fertiliser application
IITA advise say to recommend beta fertiliser for soya bean production, pesin go need to do a gud soil test.
For normal kondition, soya bean as legume wey e be suppose provide esef wit nitrogenthroughbiological nitrogen fixation.
Until nodulation don happun, di soya bean plant go dey depend on di soil nitrogen to grow.
Phosphorus na im di plant dey lack pass, derefor, make u put di best phosphorous fertiliser so e go fit grow well.
Di institute still advise farmers say make dem put di fertiliser inside di soil wen dem dey harrow and level di farm.
Pests, diseases and weeds
Na problem Perennial and most annual weeds be to soya bean wen e jus dey grow
Gud weed kontrol programme for di proper time fit reduce di effect of weed.
Weed kontrol for soya bean fit be manual or chemical, or both.
Manual weed kontrol
: Make u do di first weedin two weeks afta plantin and di second one, five to six weeks afta plantin.
Make u no weed di farm immediately rain fall, becos dis go make di weed grow for anoda place.
bad weedin or delay fit make di yield reduce badly.
Chemical weed kontrol:
Herbicides na safe and effective way to kontrol weed for soya bean farming, if we use am wella.
Di kind herbicide wey u go use kom depend on di kind weed wey dey dere and if di herbicide dey available.
Herbicides dey available for pre-emergence or post-emergence weed kontrol for soya bean.
If u use herbicide durin plantin, u go need weed di farm five to six weeks afta plantin.
Na different insects dey affect soya bean farm, but na only few of dis insects no get any economic importance, and dose ones wey fit damage crops no dey plenty reach di amount wey go need kontrol measures.
Durin di vegetative stage, di crop dey immune to caterpillars but e dey very weak to silverleaf whitefly attack.
Harvest
Soya bean dey ready to harvest for shelling and fresh use from 65 days afta planting.
Howeva, dry soya beans need 100 or more days befor u fit harvest am.
Soya bean farmers don advise say for beans wey get green shell, u fit harvest am wen di pods dey green, full and plump.
Agents wey get license for FIFA and UEFA don storm Kano to search for talented players
A team of European scout, unda di umbrella of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project don arrive for Kano city to conduct one U-16 football talent hunt from June 1.
Wen dem dey follow tori pipo yarn on Wednesday, di agents tok say dia decision to conduct di scoutin programme for Kano na becos of di high numba of young and talented players wey dey available for selection.
Di Chief Executive Officer of 60 Goals Soccer Star Project, Jane Ndubuisi, wey be FIFA middle-man agent too, add am join say dem bring di project to empower Kano youthsthroughfootball.
We dey hia, to pick talents and to help dem achieve dia dreams.

How Kano dey bikom Nigeria rice milling hub
As many rice mill dey spring up for Kano, and as production dey increase, di state don dey turn di hub for rice, no be only for Nigeria but West Africa
Di rice farming activities for Kano don be like record-breaking achievement for di history of Nigeria.
As pipo dey eat rice don increase to 4.7%, e don grow four times di global consumption growth
Na wetin trigger revolution for di sector be dat, na wetin kos di increase for rice milling for Kano.
For area dem like Kura, Gezawa, Bunkure, Garun Malam and Tudun Wada local goment wey dey di state, e dey common to dey see plenty small-scale rice millers wey dey do business.
Na di first mega rice mill wey woman be di owner be dis for Kano State
Di result be say di number of rice farmer dem increase for di state bikos say demand don increase
Dem be report say rice milling revolution for Kano start for 2014 wen 70,000 farmer dem dey map out to benefit from di dry season faring programme wey dey apun for di state.
Dem don record am say for 2019, na first in Africa Nigeria rank and 14th largest producer of rice for di world, as Chine top di kontri list

Two Cameroonian soldiers wey dem send go Nigeria na dem dey kil for Saturday for one Boko Haram attack for northeastern Borno State.

Dem kil Cameroonian soldier dem too wey dem send make dem kom assist from across di border.

Dem three Cameroonian Defence Force soldeir dem ad Nigerian soldier injure for di fight, na di military man tok am.
How you fit avoid wayo pipo if you dey play for online casino for Nigeria
Nigeria be one kontri wey dey offer plenty things wey you fit do to enjoy yasef
Many pipo love to dey visit di kontri, and dem love di oppurtunity wey dey available to dem.
Online casino dey wey dey operate witout integrity
You suppose dey doubt some, but you fit no know which casino wey dey legit and which one wey go scam you
You fit check di list wey fit guide you to di best online casino wey dey Nigeria and here be good place wey you fit start.
Nigeria be like evri oda land
Criminals wey out wey dey look for how dem go scam you, especially for cyber world
Many go tok say dem be legit casino or say dem dey offer you legit investment opportunity, na your moni dem go steal and your identity
Na why you need do search and reseach to make sure say dem no go scam you.
If you think am, you go see say na thousands pipo dem dey dey scam for online evriday
Dis na international palava, where you dey live no matter
Pipo for United States, China, England, Brazil and even for Nigeria na em diz scammers dey do wayo.
E go pay you make you get plan for how you go protect yasef make dem no scam you.
As technology don dey grow, e dey important to always dey dey safe and secure for online
Di first thing wey you suppose consider wen you dey choose online casino na to pick opetion wey be say e dey recognise well well, one wey be international option
Some onlice casino dey wey don get licence for different kontri wey dey dis world
Dem get reputtation on wetin dem don do and dem don prove demsef say dem be operatoe wey you fit trust
Na great place to start e be
You know say if dem dey oiperate for inside di kontri, dem dey do thungs di right way
Dem get million customer dem wey fit attest say dem be correct pipo, and na something you go wan depend upon
To dey operate legally for inside Nigeria, di online casino operator go need get license from di Nigerian goment
If dem no get am, den dem no get legal power to dey operate
Di site suppose get infomate wey go tell you about dia license and how dem take get am
Dem go let you sabi operator dem wey dey licence casino, wey get legat ground to dey provide service for inside di kontri border
One old adage dey wey tok say if something dey too good to be true, den na em
If online operator dey promise or e dey promise different guarantees or promise wey sound outrageous, dem probably be
No casino operator go offer times 10 for match to wetin you deposit before, for example
Dem no go guarantee say players win 50% of di time
Dem no dey real
If dem promise you wetin dey sensational and offer wey dey too good, make you leave am
You dey save yasef headache if you do am
Wetin you go use pay be one big indicator wey you go use trust online casino
If dem fit accept payment like Visa or MasterCrad, den you get confidence say na trustworthy site
Diz credit card company dem dey vet business and organisation dem wey dey accept payment from diz credit card company dem
Dis be one of di best indicator say dem wan scam you.
You fit no dey good at tech, but things dey wey you suppose know for you to use di website safely
Things like HTTP certificate and good connection between ya komputa and di server to di onlice casino dey important
Dem suppose dey use yechnology wey dey protect account information and e suppose get sensational cyber security
Na things wey dey like dis you fit give attention wey fit help you know if make you trust di online casino or not

200 entrepreneurs na dem one Foundation train for Enugu
At least, 200 youths for Udi Local goment wey dey Enugu State don graduate for 3 months Youth ICT and Skil Acquisition Project wey Baywood Foundation organise for di area
Na for vocational skil like ICT, photography, digital marketing, graphic desigh, confectionery and odas na em dey train dem on.
For January 2021, na em di Foundation get a $98,925 grant from Coca-Cola Foundation make dem use am empower 600 youths for inside Enugu State
Di 200 youth kom from inside Enugu West Sednetorial Zone, dem go train anoda 200 youth dem for inside Igboese North Council (Enugu North Senatorial Zone) and anoda 200 youth dem wey dey Enugu East Council (Enugu East Senatorial Zone).
100 youth dem wey do well well go get seed grant of N45,000 and N60,000 each for inside di 600 pipo wey dey participate for di project
E tok say 33 of di 200 pipo wey dey graduate wey get better performance go get grant

We fit no know say Nigeria dey one of di target market for university dem wey dey United Kingdom
History sef dey wey fit show how events for Nigeria fit affect how institutions of higer learning wey dey United Kingdom fit survive.
Mrs. Elizabeth Ivase (1936-2019) be di first minister wey be female for northern Nigeria
Na she be di minister of education inside Second Republic
As her important position take be, di University of Wales, wey she don study before, be invite her kom Cardiff
Na dia she pledge say for evri year, Nigeria goment go dey sponsor Nigerians to kom study for inside University Colledge Cardiff where different social science and humanities course dem dem dey do.
Di moni wey dem go see for Nigerian student for inside few years too big and e make dem incurre huge debt take  build and expand dia facilities
Dem dey sure say di moni wey dey kom from Nigeria go fit service di debt
One military officer wey be Muhammadu Buhari dey lurk for shadow, e dey ready to distrupt di Republic wey pledge dem big moni wey be tuition fee
Wen Buhari distrupt di Republic, e no be news say UCC don dey verge of bankruptcy.
To scatter evrithing for UCC, Buhari goment kom outside wit policy say di idea of goment scholarship dem wey dem dey use abroad dey ecnonomically imprudent especially for degree programe wey dem fit do for inside Nigeria
UCC be UK university, wey dey operate like Nigeria university bikos say dem don dey used to funds wey dey kom from Nigeria until experince be dia best teacher
To save di small thing wey UCC still get, University of Wales institute of Science and Technology (UWIST) join bodi wit UCC to form wetin dem call University of Wales College of Cardiff (UWCC)
Dis tori wey we tok so be report for inside paper wey dem title Financial management in universities: The lessons from University College, Cardiff, wey dem publish for inside Financial Accountability & Management (1988 Jun;4(2):99-112)
Di paper tok di circumstances wey UCC dey and how dem reach verge of bankruptcy, and e refer di relationship wey dey between UCC and Nigeria concerning international student dem
Na di institution be di present Cardiff University

E tok saymake di constitution review touchlight religious tolerance and freedom wey go make peace and stability dey.
Di implication be say 50 million tons of crop go dey reduce if e no dey consumed by cattle
Make we no mention sorghum wey account for 50% of di total cereal wey dem produce and e occupy about 45% of di total land area wey dem devote for cereal production
Make we add to diz, di million ton of grass wey dey fallow land and open range
To access diz fodder dem, wey dey always dey available only for situ, cattle go move and dem go dey openly gaze
for many case, dem go pay farmer and take permission before dem do am
Na diz touchlight why kilo of beef dey sell for N1700
Until di kontri get ways wey dem fit process di fodder dem, banning open grazing no fit apun
But I know say some wayo pipo wey dey among herder dem dey engage for criminal things and justice system no see dem prosecute
Na small scale livestock producer dem wey settle for different different community wey dey Nigeria
Dem go negotiate wit pipo wey get di community t buy land wey dem go build, grow dia crop and keep dia cattle
She tok say di center don agree and stand gidigba for INEC for di review and realignment of some of im department make im dey very very capable to fit produce result and efficient for  di management of im human resources and assets.
dem don add 6 NIPP plant dem, 22 new substation for di power grid wey dey 6 years report.
Generation companies (GenCos) and 22 power substation wey dem build and dey operate between 2015 and now, don make improvement dey for di national eletcricity grid to di 5,800 megourtt wey be di highest peak energy wey dem record for March 2021.
Dis dey according to di latest NIPP report on top power project execution since 2015, wey Daily trust obtained from di Niger Delta power holding company (NDPHC).
Di NIPP na di intervention vehicle warehouse wey di federal, state and local goment own for NDPHC.
For 2015, di power grid don dey between 4,500 megourtts (MW) wey don bikom useful by di commissioning and utilisation of Geregu, Omotosho, Olorunshogo, Alaoji, calabar, Ihovbor NIPP GesCos
Dat one add nearly 1,000MW
Howeva, di grid continue to dey rise wit all-time peak electricity wey don reach 5,801.60MW as of March 2021, according to di statistics wey we get from independent system operation (ISO) arm of di Transmission company of Nigeria. (TCN)
NDPHC don start di NIPP intervention wit di first phase wey dey power generation.
E don begin dey build 10 power GenCos wey dem dey call ' The Big Ten' around gas-producing state dem wey include Ondo, Ogun, and Kogi states.
Howeva, work still dey go on dem till 2015
Dem lunch the second phase for 2015 to include intervention project, wey go focus on transmission, distribution, and energy wey dem don renew towards meeting NDPHC mandate for lighting di nation.
currently, dem bin dey six power GenCos wey dey produce about 3,400MW electricity for di national grid while di four oda GenCos dey ongoing.
Even among di four, some of im turbines don dey commission and dey operational since 2015.
Explanation of di report show say di NIPP intervention for di transmission section wey dey di power sector value di chain, NDPHC don complete 22 substations wey bin dey compromise 10 units of 330/132 kilovolts (KV) level and 12 units of 132/33KV  substations.
E don also complete 2,194 kilometres wey dey 330KV power transmission line and 887km wey dey 132KV transmission lines.
Dis infracstructure since 2015, don add  5,590MVA energy supply capacity wey dey 330KV level and 3,793MVA wey dey 132KV level.
To promote energy wey dey clean and improve, di NIPP for di second phase don turn to major driver of di federal goment energy mix by 2030 wey dem dey call vision 30-30-30 wich seek energy wey go improve to at least 30 percent of di energy grid by 2030.
While e don install 20,000 solar home systems for some northen states, di NIPP don dey deliver a huge part of the ongoing five million SHS to domot nationwide under di Economic Sustainability plan (ESP).
Dia bin dey intervention for di gas sector wey go solve major challenge of di power plant wich be di availability of gas-to-power.
According to di oga patapata for NDPHC, Mr Chiedu Ugbo, for interview wey im get with Daily Trust,di company dey achieve dis tru di fuel and gas or public private partnership model.
E don create a department for dis to spearhead im gas pipeline and feed stock wey dey connect all di 10 NIPP GenCon.
wen dem tok power distribution, di report tok say di NIPP intervention bin don see di completion of ovr 360 NIPP injection substations wit a combined capacity wey reach 3,540 MW.
To complement dis substations, NDPHC don build about 2,600KM of 11KV power distribution lines and 4600KM of 33KM distribution lines wey dey supply electricity directly to transformer
Dia bin dey 296 appointed project wey dem don distribute, wich injection substations dey inside, 1924 of 33kv lines, 4600km of 11kv lines wit dem oda infastruction 
NDPHC sef don increase im distribution capacity wit di installation of 25,900 completely self-protected (CSP)  transformer wey dey across obodo, nah Mr Ugbo add dis one. 
On top all dis achivement wey don help to improve di operation of national grid, di report highlight threat to di infastructure especially for di one wey dey di power distribution level.
Some of di wahala wey NDPHC dey see for dis distribution be say dem dey tif dia equipment and infrastructure, vandalism, and lack of cooperation from Distribution companies (DisCos
Di oda nah community wahala wey dey regard land and Right of way ( ROIs), motor accident wey don damage some power infrastructure and rising insecurity wey dey facility areas, e start
for a comment wey go empty di property of di NIPP intervention to Nigerian wey dey comsume electricity, di President for di Nigeria consumer Protection Network ( NCPN), Barrister Kunle Kola Olubiyo, im tok say di reason for di power sector privatatization exercise wey dem conclude for November 2013 hapen to promote competitive economy and inclusive growth by 
Im howeva tok say despite dis, di sector neva reach dat kin viability, so di goment need to deepen di interventions tru NIPP.
On top all di tremendous milestone wey NIPP/NDPHC don achieve, dia bin major area of impediment wey dey full realizeation of di lofty idea wey di management of NDPHC championed.
Mr Olubiyo tok say di wahala dem dey face include delay in taking over projects by di DisCos wich dem suppose capture for dia capital Expenditure ( CAPEX)
Im continue im tok say nah di Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) bin di inderance for di delay in di implementaion of di regulations of eligeable consumer
wit di kin huge power assets wey NIPP don provide, di Manufacturers Association of Nigeria ( MAN) and oda dedicated power users fit decide to connect to di NIPP plants and facilities directly and dey enjoy uninterrupted power supply, but dis bin dey delay.
Anoda wahala wey NDPHC dey get nah funding, wich im think say di equity stakeholders suppose raise for more power sector projects.
Di leadearship of di power sector go need to address di low tariff wey dey NIPP plants and di low load (Energy) dispatch wey dey available units from TCN
Consumer dem dey look for more electricity, why energy from NIPP GenCos con dey restricted ?
Nah so Olubiyo ask.
unlike oda places, Ramadan season for Nigeria don unfortunately turn into a season wey dey get unnecessary controversy
Di controvercy don start from di arrival of di Ramadan crescent wey dey usher in di new month and di moon go waka commot to show e end. 
di Ramadan peroid dey equally witness controversy ova ideological, jurisprudential or political stances wey some Ulama expressed for di course of dia Quranic trfseer sessions
ova many many years, dia bin don dey unnecessary controversy ova say wich charitable work better pass between make dem dey suponsor broadcast Quranic tafseer abi make dem dey do charitable mass feeding of di needy for Ramadan. 
As e dey go for oda Muslim societies, Ramadan dey always inspire a phenomenal risefor individual and for societal spirituality for Nigeria wer plenty  wealthy pipo dey sponsorlive or recorded broadcast for Quranic tafseer by different Ulama
Many oda pipo dey spend more on top charitable feeding of di poor.
Howeva, while almost, if no be all, who dey sponsor di broadcast tafseerb dey spend for di charitable feeding too, no be all wey dey spend for charitable feeding dey suponsor di broadcast of tafseer.
Ramadan period for northern Nigeria, television and radio stations dey make profit wit di sale of airtime for tafseer and oda religious lectures wey individual, firms and groups sponsor
from di kin number of sponsor broadcast of tafseer an dem oda religious lecture wey dey for like 10 radio stations for Kano, for example, one fit begin dey wonda weda dem dey do oda programme for Ramadam period. 
E good say dem dey sponsor tafseer broadcast, especially for Ramadan, di amount wey dem dey spend for dis regard be like say im dey imbalance if we consider di kin hunger wey dey wire di needy 
afta all, if dem get chance to choose, dem go certainly choose food hangout ova dat kin sponsored broadcast, as e don be say public tafseer session dey evriwia for Ramadan wey persin fit choose wich to attend.
Besides, di kin underlying dynamics and politics wey dey for sponsoring Ramadan tafseer broadcast, persin no fit rule out Riyaa, sectarian and even political interest wey be di main motives for di sponsor of tafseer and dem oda religious lectures.
Wetin dey interesting be say, while some sponsor dey compete for who go sponsor di broadcast of tafseer wey some prominent Ulama dey anchor, some of di Ulama dey sponsor dia own broadcast tafseer even if dem no see persin wey wan sponsor;  odas even dey beg for sponsor wey go sponsor dia programme.
Also, di content wey some tafseer and oda religious lectures dey feature get some serious flaws, to dey sponsor dis kin broadcast nah big misplacement of priority
anoda thing wey dey interesting be say, some dey sponsor di broadcast of Adhan ( Kiran sallah) for inside city like Kano. 
wia, thank you to sheer wey dey increase for Mosques, regular Adhan don dey reach evri corner 
Anyway, Ikhlas bin di ogbonge yardstick way dey determine if weda charitable feeding and di sponsoring of Ramadan tafseer  broadcast dey worthy or not, striking appropriate balance between di two go give better outkom.
Even though say Ramadan be di month of di Quran wey be say Muslims suppose dey commited in terms of reading, learning wetin im mean and to dey live dia lives accordingly
Di month nah di month of generous charity wey be say Muslims, particularly di ones wey dey wealthy suppose dey do charity work, especially mass feeding.
Howeva, while dat one com be di bottom line, wich explain why di controversy no dey necessary, di Liberal Musilims don over do am
capitalizing on top public frustration wey dey inside di hunger wey dey wire di society, dem dey kwesion weda di sponsoring of di broadcast Ramadan tafseer dey worthy or relevance for under dis kin condition wey we dey find ourselves.
As dem don pretend show empathy and concern, dey tok say di two charity work be di same and make pipo choose between dem.
Under di hard condition wey pipo dey, e no surprise to dey see many pipo, including di ones wey fit discern, fall for di propaganda wey dem no know e context, nah im be di raging face-off wey dey between di Liberal Muslims, for anoda side, dem bin wan undermine Islamic and moral values for di society by force, togada with di
Also, contrary to wetin dem claim, di Liberal Muslims no dey disturb by di kin wahala wey dey for di vulnerable, dis don explain why dem neva urge those wey dey spend huge resources on top oda things, no mater how worthless im be, make dem divert di resources to charitable course.
Dem neva urge dat di kin massive amounts of  resources dia elite role spend on top say dey wan maintain dia big lifestyles suppose dey diverted for di feeding of di poor or to take give dem shelter 
Instead, dia conscience go kom alive wen resources dey for only, say, Hajj, Umrah, Daourh
Federers conqueror dey amazed by dream day wey dey di office
Afta  im don wreck, Roger Federers return to di tennis courts, Pablo Andujar tok say dat na di sweetest moment a lengthy career.
 Spaniard beat Federer 6-4,4-6,6-4 on top di Geneva clay for Tuesday to scata  di swiss tennis great hopes wey dem wan use run di match togeda ahead different major tournaments wey French open, Wimblendon and di Tokyo olympics.
For match point on Tuesday, Andujar, wey be di world number 75, hold im head for im hand in disbelief afta he don beat di 20-time Grand slam champion.
I no fit believe am, nah wetin di 35-year-old tell ATPTour.com. 
Di memories of Nigeria colo wey dey for black and white(iii)
sometimes afta dat, and afta I don get like two popular strip wey dey for di now default news paper wey dem dey call The Democrat, I get my first four letters wey reject me from Mavel Comics, I gada myself remain a young man wey still get hope.
with di kin ups and downs wey dey for Nigeria, im still allow me get dream, to be artist wey dey work for a ogbonge culture company wey for anoda kontiri, anoda continent
Fast-forward to 20002, one day as I dey sit down for di post office wey dey di centre of di city to drop off my latest art sample to Marvel Submission Editor, I no fit get bus
Plenty pipo dey use leg take waka, some gada for group, dem dey worry.
I dey weird out, waka go home, only to hear say raiot don start.
again, many pipo die for di riot, farmilies and friends tear apart as Christian dey beingn move to Kaduna South and Muslims begin move from Kaduna South to di North 
My Kaduna, my Nigeria, don dey fall apart.
Di small consolation wey I get be some Christian friend wey stay for certain areas, like me, dem feel safe and no go anywia
So,  as di violence dey intense for oda parts, I go dey play soccer for my street, dey exchange VHS tapes and bootlegs VCDs
Di idea to dey hate persin bikos of im religion or ethnic dey incredible for us.
But one teen, wey just move to our domot some years, nah im make me get encounter with intolerance.
if to say we be Muslims, playing soccer, dis new guy call us make we go attack di infidel wey dey live down di road.
we com look each oda jokingly, we dey confuse, afta wich we burst to laughter, we com tell say make im get out.
As if dat one no bad reach, my heartbreak for don worse as I see di apprearance of labels and slur from both of dem.
My perfect Kaduna don dey fall apart, and families and friends don dey part ways, no be say dem no love each oda but bikos say dat na di safest thing to do.
afta di wahala don end, I begin face university with cautious optimism.
literally, many old friend dey there, as Zaria no too far from Kaduna.
Many pipo dey get new friend, some dey till today, some don dey stronger 
The best part be say, all dis friend dem weda new or old, no dey base on religion or ethnicity
Some of us wey notice know say, di Kaduna wey we know, love and don lose, neva really destroy. 
E no fit go bikos say nah for our heart im reside, so e go hard to kil patapata
Afta all di almost 29 years wey I don spend as a journalist, show me things wey plenty pipo no fit experience for dia life.
I get front row seat to fight for, gbege attack, concerts by superstars dem, movies premieres and all kin generation-defining moments
I also get to dey interview for some big big newsmaker wey dey Nigeria, during moment wey dem get most chutzpah, or nothin at all.
Nah di Nigeria wey no get worrior wey no fit fight for  social justice, virtue-signalers, outrage-peddlers, or cancel culture- purveyor.
Nah di Nigeria wey dey flawed, still dey remind me of my old Kaduna, even though di image different to each oda.
But bodi no fit take all of dem for too long.
On top of bed, I con look around my old room again, evrithin just dey as I leave am before im coronavirus lockdown.
I com smile to myself, nah from dat moment I begin to dey decide on di kin steps wey I go take.
I com twist di rubber band round di sack of fotos two times, com put am back for inside longbox.
Maybe one day I go look oda ones, di colour foto, wey carry more recent memories.
Maybe I no go do am.
One thing dey clear say: nah my mother, and father, and di kin relationship wey dem get or wey dem no get wit me, nah im make me di kin child wey I be. 
Wetin I be to oda kids wey know me, also di kin man wey I be, to pipo wey know me.
But I find am as wahahla, and e dey relieve more for my sack of black and white fotos, I don realize say while my head guide di kin persin wey I be, nah my heart don dey keep me Nigerian all dis years.
42 Niger communities wey dey under Boko Haram dey control Senator Musa. 
Di Senator wey dey represent Niger East for di National Assembly, Senator Mohammed Sani Musa, im tok say about 42 communities wey dey Niger State don fall under Boko Haram control.
Dem don showcase 5,000 villagers for di last three days.
Dis dey kom after Niger state governor, Sani Bello, don raise alarm say di insurgents don hoist dia flag for some communities.
Speaking on di ground of senate on Tuesday while dem dey move on a motion on di kilins wey dey apun for Shiroro, Muya and Rafi local goment areas for Niger state, Senator Musa tok say bandit and terrorist don kil ova 475 persins for Niger East between 2020 till date. 
Di lawmakers don express im worry dat almost seven years now Niger East Senatorial Districts wey dey Niger Delta don dey under eviriday and dey sustain plenty deadly attack by heartless, venomous, hydraheaded Boko Haram terrorist.
Di result don dey total collapse wey dey di local economies of di affected victims, total collapse of educational system for di affected areas, famine don dey bikos of di collapse of agricultural activities, displacement wey be as a result of distortion of crisis prone areas, depopulation as a result of wanton death, wey dey among odas.
Im tok say di attack are taking places for di absence of di slightest hindrances, resistance of confrotation from authorities.
Dem don kidnap many and don seize dem wives from dem com forcefully attached dem to Boko Haram members.
Three military camps wey dey Allour, Bassa and Zagzaga for di two local goment area don get sack, di insurgents don kil some security personnel in di last one month of di renewed attack
I fit confirm am authoritatively say Boko Haram terrorist don mount dia flags for many places wey dem don capture like Kure, Alour and Magani
Dey don abandoned pipo wey dey dis wat-torn part of di states and leave dem make dem face dia wahala, make dem dey in agony wey no get end and dey deep inside poverty.
 futhermore, for dis moment primary schools for Gwada,Kuta, Pandogari and Minna dem don carry dem do IDP camp as dem dey follow di sacking of almost 5600 villagers from dia ancestral homes in Shiroro, Rafi and Munya local goment area for di last few weeks by di armed rubber  wey don raid  di town and villages.
Wetin dis mean be say if dey fit attack without hindrance for Niger East Senatorial districts. 
I no know how we wan take bikom safe for Abujan again.
Im tok say March 2021 to date some jaguda don kil more 25 gallant soldier dem, policemen and oda security personnel while 16 civillians die, and dem no fit account for many odas.
If dem no address dis threat drastically, di attack go continue and di danger wey day dat one be say e fit bikom wetin we no fit handle further to oda communities.
Wey bin farming communities and dem bin farmers, dem fit comot dia farm dis season and dis fit negatively affect food surficiency and economic diversification policy of di Federal Goment, im added.
My visit go Adamour state
Working wit di goment for any level don offer innovators like me di chance to dey bring more beta and transformation wey we ordinarily no fit do for our field 
I strongly believe say di goment, as institution, be di greatest vehicle for systemic change and positive transformation wey persin no fit find anywia.
For dat, weneva I kom across opportunities to work wit dem goment bodi, weda local or nah for outside country, I dey always dey hapi bikos say e represent a great opportunity for me learn from and fit contribute to di civil service wey dey fields dat are exciting and dey transformative for pipo beyond wetin my
One of my recent visit of such nature nah to Adamour state, wey dey fascinating for me bikos of im diversity, resilience and outstanding potencial.
I begin dey work actively for Adamour state some years ago, wit di international organisation, OXFAM, on top a project wey dey in line wit European Union's support to food security and resilience for Nothen Nigeria were we deployed a mobile solution to integrating di agricultural value chain.
We don work wit field officers wey dey represent Fufore,Guyuk,Mubi South and Song local goment areas wey dey Adamour state to enhance agriculture and Agricbusiness practices wit tecnology.
Howeva, my return to Adamour state last year dey towards a grannder and dey get more exciting task.
E don involve a preposition to take work wit di state goment to transform di ministry of Entrepreneurship and Development and poverty Alliviation togeda wit di wealth creation Agency( PAWECA) wit di general aim of how to dey reduce poverty and dey sustainably dey improve prosperity for di teeming young pipo wey dey di state.
For some context, I dey very delighted to learn dat di state goment don establish di ministry of entrepreneurship and Development wey go help lay focus on entrepreneurship and to acquire technical skil.
E no exist untill di goment of Ahmadu Umar Fintiri administration com establish am, di ministry don bikom di key pillar of di administration strategies wey dey towards economic development of di state.
Di role of dis institution dey sailent as im supporse be for Adamour state, wit im fair share of youth unemployment, security and oda challenges.
Im dey, howeva, very very evident dat the Adamour state ministry of Entrepreneurship and development, togeda wit Poverty Alleviation and Wealth Creation Agency (PAWECA), e fit dey adequately utilised for trasforming di local economy, boosting youth entrepreneurship and to dey reduce unemployment drastically for di state.
But as im be for most goment institutions, dis dey require discipline and dedicated effort to fit achieve dem
Typically, for wia dey exist, complex international organisational challenges don shackle di growth and efficiency of dis kin institutions.
For persin to understand dis conundrum, I tok to Adamour state's secretary to di state goment, Malam Bashiru Ahmed, who no dey only passionate about di issue but dey remarkably informed about local and global effort wey dey around am and as such uniquely position to help chat oury solving am
Im repeat Governor Fintiri commitment to take solve youth wey no get job and enhance di local economy by boosting entrepreneurship.
Malam Bashiru don express im idea and understanding wey dey around reforming and improving di  capacity of ministries and agencies of goment, arguing dat di desire transformation only fit be possible if dem enhance di culture of innovation, embrace di use of technology, and if dem improve internal processeces and procedures so dat
Nah bikos of di challege wey most public and private institution dey seek to solve continue to dey generate demands wey only technologically savvy, innovation-driven, forward thinking, and efficient institution fit do.
In di course of di weeks to follow afta dis encounter, I also meet di Commissioner of di Ministry of Entrepreneurship and Youth Development, Ilya James and di head of Poverty Alliviation and Wealth Creation (PAWECA) Hajiya Aisha Bello, make dem examine wetin dem have and dia lay grounds for developing initiatives base on
we wan establish organisational culture wey dey efficient and fit give result and go equip di ministry and agency to bikom innovation-driven through di use of technology.
In a way wey dey demostrable and fit give result we go initiate human-centre design thinking among staff and optimaize internal processes to ensure quality service delivery
last last, we go offer tools wey go dey for di monioring and measuring of organaisational performance of di ministry agency.
Dis go go hand in hand for di already existing togada wit newly-hatched programs and campaings of di two institutions
Governor fintiri administration, by im sheer resolve and commitment wey dey towards capacity development ey dey in partnership wit various global and indeed local partner like di United Nation and Development Programme (UNDP) and di Nigerian Content Development Board (NCDB), upgrading vocational and fabrication centres like di vocational
I dey quite inspired by di kin obsession wey Governor Fintiri get for local content participation policies wey dey all project and programme, wey dey evident for di goment derive for local content participation in di NEDC rapid response projects togeda wit bin di key galvaniser and pivot wey dey di North East Governor's forum.
As I land for Yola dis week, di state capital of Adamour, amidst all dis aspirations for di great Fombina, as dem dey call di religion historically, I dey beset wit a renewed melanchonly for di loss of one of di greatest sons of Adamour, and Nigeria ogbonge public servant and academic Dr. Mahmud Tukur, who for im life time don
We pray make Allah grant im great rewards, and make us fulfill im dream and aspiration for Nigeria as a whole.
Sinner do set up Nadal clash for Rome second round
Jannik sinner do book a second-round showdown wit nine-time champion Rafael Nadal fot Italian open afta a 6-2, 6-4 over Frenchmen Ugo Humbert on Monday.
Di Italian teenager go  face di 20-time Grand slam winner for di second time, afta im don impress against Nadal in last years.
French Open quarter-finals even though dem don lose for straight sets.
Nadel don have a 9-2 record on clay dis season but dey beat am for di last eight for both previous masters events, for Monte Carlo and Madrid.
Aslan Karatsev don dey same wit Sinner wit im 20th win of di season.
Di Russian beat Miomir Kecmanovic 7-6 (7/2), 6-4 for di opening round.
Nigerians don vex as Governors don mull N408 per litre for fuel price.
Nigerians dem don express dia anger ova di proposal of di Nigeria goment Forum (NGF) committees on top fuel subsidy, to push for deregulation of di downstream.
for a virtual meeting wey apun for Wednesday, di committee wey di state governor of Kaduna Nasir El-Rufai chaired inside a report, recommended a Premium Motor Spirit(PMS) wey dem dey also call petrol price wey between N408.5 per litre and N380 per litre while dem dey call for immediate removal of fuel subsidy
El-Rufai tok say dem no fit sustain di current subsidy regime, and only smugglers dem and dem illegal markets dey benefit from am.
Im also tok say Nigeria no fit benefit from di recent production wey Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), which dem suppose keep di fuel price high, bikos of subsidies.
Nah between N70 billion and 210 bn dem estimate to be dey spend evri month for di price of gasoline to remain 165 per litre, dis dey below di cost price and di moni wey den give to di federation account go shrink to less dan 50bn per month or even zero if threats persist, im tok.
Di committee don recommend PMS pump price increment from di current N162per litre to N408.5 per litre
Reacting to dis on Thursday, Nigerians across di states don show dia anger on di governors.
ForAnambra state, a civil servant, Mr. Uzoma Okeke tok say di proposal dey unthinkable if we dey look di state of economy of the nation.
A driver wey im name be, Michael Okafor tok say im don dey struggle to buy petrol for N170/litre inside di state.
Inside Jos for Plateau State, Malam Nura Alhassan wey be tailor, don express im disappointment on top di development.
If di proposal don turn reality, di poor inside dis kontiri go suffer plenty bikos say whateva figure dem don increase, nah ordinary Nigerian go feel am.
More pipo dem don react to dis inside Kaduna, Port Harcourt, Abeokuta, Jos and Kano.
For instance, inside Kano, Buhari Abba Rano, 36, tok say Wit dis kin level of insecurity wey dey around Nigerian governors dem dey busy dey start fake projects dem and loitering around Abuja and overnight agitating for complete deregulation.
Dis don show say our crude oil don dey useless and dem no care about di dem lives of di common man.
Fatima Baba Kura tok im believe say dis price wey dem propose go kos set back for di kontiri to a worse state than wetin im don be.
Inside Lagos, many Nigerians dem don express shock ova di don already propose fuel price increment from di governors dem who suppose to dey defend dia pipo.
A student, Miss Onyekachi Emeka tok say di price increase go fit trigger increase inside transportation fare.
For inside Akwa Ibom, Abia and Edo states, di residents dem don corroborated di view of oda Nigerians dem as dem dey described di proposal as unfair to di Nigerian pipo dem who don already have enough of di inflation rate, high cost of food and fuel and di security situation wey don dey spoil.
Experts dem don tell FG say make im don discard proposal
Experts wey react to dis development don bin urge di federal goment make dem discard di governors dem proposal for di best interest of dem Nigerian.
Di pesin wey dey for in charge petrol industry, Siraju Oyewale tok say  arbitrary fixing of fuel price dey diffirent to di principle of deregulation.
I get problem wit pipo wey dey sit down dey sit down dey fix prices for petrol.
Dat one no dey deregulation
Dat one still be price regulation.
Politicians dem, or even dem goment agencies wey dey fix prices dey different to di principle of deregulation.
Even though say im support deregulation, Oyewale tok say di price go rise above di current price but e no go reach N380.
Oyewale also tok say Nigeria must to refine im crude oil for locally level to tackle di petrol import cost  wey dey rise by NNPC.
An economic expert wey dey stay for Abuja, Samson Simon Galadima tok say selling petrol for price wey dey twice di current price go further exacerbate inflationary pressure, hence, impoverishing Nigerians dem even more as purchasing power don reduce.
Galadima tok say lasting solution to Nigeria's fuel price wey no stable go dey deeply diversified energy-mix bikos our overdependence on petrol no dey healthy.
President of di Independent Marketers Association of Nigeria (IPMAN), Chinedu Okoronkwo tok say e dey wrong for di NGF to dey fix fuel price.
Im tok say full deregulation go encourage more local and foreign investors dem to invest inside di sector and grow di economy but dat di governor's proposal should not be honoured.
NNPC tok say nah only FG fit tell us how much to dey sell fuel
Di Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) don tok say e no go go wit di proposal by NGF dat make dem sell a litre of petrol for N380.
Persin wey dey speak for NNPC Dr Kennie Obateru wey torchlight dis to Daily Trust on Thursday tok say as di fuel price be now, e don dbikom policy issue and nah only di federal goment fit direct di corporation to sell for a specific price.
We still dey wait for di conclusion of di meeting wey dey go on  between di organised labour and the Federal Goment.
nah afta di outkom of di meeting we fit announce di price 
NNPC don tok say di NGF only made a proposal wey fit be accepted or discarded by di federal goment.
PDP goment lack moral standing to dey demand for restructuring APC chieftain
A chieftain of di ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) and Director General of the Progressives Governors Forum (PGF), Salihu Mohammed Lukman tok say dem governors wey dem elect on di platform of di pipos Democratic parti (PDP) don lack di moral standing to demand for executive bill and restructuring of di ogbodo.
Few days ago afta PDP governor dem don do dia meeting for inside Ibadan, dem ask President Muhammadu Buhari make im send executive bill to di National Assembly make dem amend di kontiri's Constitution to devolve plenty powers to di states among odas.
But reacting in a statement yesterday, di PGF Director General tok say nothing dey new inside di resolutions as progressive governors in line wit recommendations wey dem contain for di APC Committee on top True Federalism, don already take a position on top di matta and since don communicate am to di top echelon of di National Assembly.
Has dem don mismanage dem opportunities to initiate all di recommendations dem wey dem bin don propose by di PDP governors dem between 1999 and 2015, how anybodi for inside PDP go dey claim any moral standing to dey demand for any executive bill? 
If to say di issue is dey as simple as getting di President to transmit executive bill, wetin stop all di PDP President dem from initiating am for sixteen years?
Nah 18 elephants dem lightning kil for India.
Dem see herd of 18 wild Asiatic elephants wey die for inside India's eastern state of Assam, di fit apun bikos of a massive lightning strike, local officials tok am for Friday.
some village pipo dem see fourteen adult elephants on Thursday
dem see anoda bodies dem wey dem dey scata on top di foothills of di Kundoli reserve forest area of Assam, wey dey 160 kilometres from di state capital of Dispur, local wildlife official, M.K Yadava, tell Reuters.
Di state goment don order a high-level inquiry wey dey into di incident on Friday, nah Assam's Forest and Wildlife Minister, Parimal Suklabaidya, tok am.
A preliminary report reason say di deaths fit be due to lightning even though say we need to find out through forensic tests if im possible say somethin else fit be di reason like poisoning or disease, nah wetin di minister talk be dat.
Di pipo dem wey find di elephants dem, tok say im possible say nah lightning kil di animals dem on Wednesday, nah a local forest ranger tok am, im add say im see trees wey dey burn for di area.
Di ranger no tok im name as im no suppose tok to di media.
Di former deputy for national publicity secretary of di All Progressives Congress (APC), Comrade Timi Frank, im fault di appointment of Major- General Farouk Yahaya as di Chief of Army Staff. 
Frank tok for inside a statement for inside Abuja, dat President Muhammadu Buhari's penchant wan elevate junior officers inside di security establishments to superintendent ova dia seniors dem dey against di much-cherished military tradition of seniority and subordination.
Im tok say di elevation of Yahaya above im seniors dem nah direct hit against di military, wich go see senior, capable officers dem wey dem purge through compulsory retirement as we dey see am for di past.
Im tok say di development dey capable to dey breeding widespread distrust, discontent, disloyalty, low morale and lack of motivation inside di military and oda security agencies dem.
Di All Progressives Congress (APC) don express im excitement ova di recent appointment of Ahmed Mustapha Habib as di new Director-General of di National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA).
Nah di Presidential tok tok persin, Garba Shehu, nah im announce di appointment
Inside a congratulatory letta wey dey signed by dem National Secretary, Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), Sen. John James Akpanudoedehe, wey dey di ruling parti don thank President Muhammadu Buhari for considering di new appointee wey dey worthy of di position.
I write to convey di jolification of di National Chairman Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), H.E (Hon)
Di particular appointment nah demonstration of reward say im dey loyal to di parti and say dem recognise im selfless service to di kontiri, attributes wey fit clearly describe your persona.
We trust say you get di capacity to do well well for dis your new assignment.
APC tok say di parti dey appreciative of dis gesture of Mr President di best in dis endeavour.
Di new oga for NEMA  get extensive experience wey don span about 25 years across different sectors, im sits on top di  Board wey get various corporate, political and youth organisations, and im be di national chairman of Progressive pipo's Alliance between 2010 and 2011.
A player wey dey active inside di organisational and policy drives of di APC goment, Habib bin dey di member of the Presidential Campaign Council inside 2019 and national chairman of di National Committee of Buhari Support Groups since 2015, and also the vice-chairman of di federal goment-run State Selection Committee on di Extended Special Public Works Programme in Jigour State.
Abia goment don reject IPOB strategy, dey demand for apology ova di war crimes wey dem hold against Igbos
Di Abia State Governor, Dr. Okezie Ikpeazu don explain why im differed wit di strategy of di Indigenous pipo of Biafra (IPOB) secession and dia strategy for gbege.
Im tok on Friday wen im visit  di digital pan-African news network, di TOS TV network, wey Ms. Osasu Igbinedion led for inside Abuja.
Di governor wey fault di strategy wey IPOB deployed led by self-exiled Nnamdi Kanu, dem howeva note dat dem no dey treat di Ndigbo fairly inside di kontiri.
According to im, di destructive strategy of IPOB bin di recipe for di breakdown of law and order inside di South East geopolitical zone.
As dem bin dey listen to oda reasons why im differ wit IPOB, di governor bin tok, But some of us no agree with im (Nnamdi Kanu) style bikos I no understand wia im dey go, wen im intend to pull di brakes and wen im go stop.
If to say I get a way wey I fit convey my view to di leadership of di group wetin I go tok be say make dem find di way to enter into conversation and let pipo know.
I no understand dia strategy and purpose.
I no understand why dem dey attack institutions of civil rule.
Plenty pipo dem wey dey apologetic to some of dis dem strategies no even know say dem dey ride for tigers tail.
If di police and military withdraw and den brigands becom enforcers of di law and order, if you get quarrel wit your broda, how you wan take resolve am?
While we still dey demand for national apology for di kin treatment dem dey meted to di Igbos during di nation's three-year civil war, Governor Ikpeazu tok say our national orientation suppose dey willing to say sorry.
No persin fit dey 100 percent korekt all in life
Even wen we wey deal wit our pikin dem if we do things wey no dey right, we suppose get di courage to come down to dia level and tell dem sorry but to create a utopian aura dat all dey well is either nothing is wrong
or I don do am, wetin you fit do?
Who fit tell us wetin apun for civil war, who do wetin and why dem do am?
why be say say some pipo no fit kom tell us say dem sorry for we dem do?
you no fit sweep somethings under di carpet.
Di tension dey palpable and dis nah di time for us to dey open up up as pipo wey love dem kontiri.
I dey speak like dis bikos say I spend seven years inside di University of Maguduri.
I don waka through all part of northern Nigeria 
and I don sabi dis kontiri
I feel bad say wetin dey bring us togeda don dey gradually go oury.
Di NYSC don collapse
We suppose dey tok di truth no matta whose o dem form. 
Some of di issues wey Nnamdi raise nah issues of injustice, marginalisation, inequality weda nah gender, generational whateva.
Any particular arm of di society wey dem exclude in any way get di right to feel say dem cheat am or dey unwanted.
so, some of di things Nnamdi tok dey valid. 
some of us fit see am.
we no fit dey continue to dey run oury from di facts
Di Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) don accuse di FCT police command of harassment and intimidation.
Di group wey protest ova di continued detention of im leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky at Wuse Market, Abuja, yesterday, claim say di police throw teargas and shot at di protesters dem.
A statement wey Abdullahi Musa sign, on behalf of di Academic Forum of di IMN, tok say the police bin dey  harass so many innocent pipo dem including passers-by, especially  women while dem dey attempt to scatta di protesters.
We kom out as usual on di streets of Abuja dey halla on di Nigerian authorities make dem respect the rule of law and make dem free our leader unconditionally and also to remind di general public dat in 2015 within 48hrs d kil ova 1000 of im followers mercilessly by the officers and soldiers of the Nigerian Army as dem don officially launch attack on im inside im own residence, dem kil almost evri soul wey dey inside di house and com set dia corpses ablaze.
Musa don add say dat di protest be don start for around 3:00 for afternoon and dey go serere from Sky Memorial but just dem wan scatta for Wuse Market, di police arrive and start to dey shoot teargas and life ammunition on di peaceful and unarmed protesters.
Di police harass plenty innocent pipo including pipo wey dey pass by wich plenty of dem be women and dem removed dia hijabs, im tok further.
di FCT police command spokespesin, ASP Maryam Yusuf, tok say di group dey disturb public peace wit dia protest.
NAPTIP arraigns, dem reunite five trafficked children wit dia parents. 
Di FCT police command spokespesin, ASP Maryam Yusuf, tok say di group dem dey disturb public peace wit dia protest.
NAPTIP, for di press briefing  at di weekend, tok say Abdulrahman, a 32-year-old man, him abducted children wey dem dey di age of four to seven and sell dem to some women wey dey different parts of di kontiri wey dey under di guise of say im adoption dem.
Di Director General, Mrs. Imaan Sulaiman-Ibrahim, wen im dey hand ova di children to dia parents im say, di suspect tell di would be parents adoption papers purportedly from di Niger State Goment.
She tok say, dem catch am red handed wen im dey help im clients fill dia adoption application forms.
She warn say make parents dem dey guard dia children dem  to avoid kidnapping wey dey apun, trafficking and oda crimes dem wey dey against humanity, she add say make dem no expose dem to pipo wey get criminal intention.
She tok say di pesin wey dey investigate di matta don follow an intelligence report dat Abdulrahman  kidnapped children from Niger State and com sell dem into different parts of di kontiri.
Di DG also tok say di intelligence report don reveal that di suspect bin don dey do dat claiming to be a staff of di Ministry of Social Development of Niger State wey dey in charge of adoption dem matta.
She tok say Abdulrahman don confess say im don collect di sum of N100,000 for each of di children.
Di parents dem don laud di federal goment and NAPTIP management for rescuing dia children and don promise to take proper care of dem.
Governors dem wey dem elect on di platform of di pipos Democratic parti (PDP) don warn di Economic and Financial Crime Commission (EFCC) make dem no dey witch-hunt im parti officials dem.
Di governors dem don dey respond to di invitation of three officials of di parti by di antigraft agency ova alleged misappropriation of N10 billion, which the Secondus-led National Working Committee (NWC) wey dem don already deny.
di forum, for di statement by im Director-General, Hon CID Maduabum, tok say di invitation of di officials ova a spurious petition by a disgruntled former member of PDP don raise quesion on di seriousness and impartiality of di anti-graft agency to do im work.
Di statement tok: While PDP as a political parti dey accountable to im members dem and di general public for im actions, we dey, howeva, concerned dat di old tactics of using di EFCC to dey silence political opposition don dey entre into our polity again.
we think say di EFCC wey dey di new leadership go learn from di mistake of pipo wey dey before am.
Nah misplaced priority e be for EFCC to dey abandon revelations of big big fraud wey many officials and agencies of di Federal goment dey do  to pursue di PDP wey be di main opposition parti doing a yeoman's job to dey prevent di descent into chaos and anarchy for inside Nigeria.
Maybe some interests inside goment dey worried about di increasingly assertive role di PDP dey play in calling out corruption inside goment and wan to weaken and silence am.
Even di message wey dem dey tok about no make any allegation of misuse of goment funds, or cheating of any persin or public authority by di PDP.
E dey surprising dat EFCC wan use im scarce human and oda resources to begin investigation into PDP finances.
If EFCC dey even-handed and dey non-partisan, e suppose conduct investigation into oda political parties including APC, wey be  di ruling party.
PDP dey up to date for making financial returns as di required by the Constitution to INEC
We no know say INEC don make complaints to EFCC on PDP's return.
We dey face existential threats as a nation and PDP suppose remain focus on im role as a watchdog on behave of Nigerians. 
Di Senator wey dey represent Kaduna Central, Uba Sani, don lament say children be di one wey dem dey suffer most for di kontiri recurring economic and security wahala dem.
For di children's day message,  Sani note say children don dey face di deprivation bikos of di insecurity wey dey many kontiri.
some of dem don dey stuck for inside Internally Displaced Persins (IDPs) camps.
dia education don suffer
plenty of dem no get access to healthcare.
Dem no get any recreation for dem
Dem dey abuse some of di girls.
Dem dey live inside di fear of di unknown.
Make we dey reflect on top our children loss of dia innocence and our duties dem and obligation wey we don lose as leaders and pipo.
plenty of dem die bikos say dem no get health care
Di economic impact of COVID-19 on dia parent dey affect di children in a nagative way.
Di quality of food wey dem dey chop don reduce to and some of dem no fit go school again, nah wetin im tok be dat.
Di lawmaker don call for effective implementation of policies and programmes wey go aim at providing betta education and betta health care for di children
Di investment wey put for our children nah di investment wey we put for di future of our kontiri. 
Im add say, make we no fail for dis regards.
Wetin dey fuel insurgency?
Wen a group of pipo wey no dey informed get an idealogy wey dey fit die for, dem go do di illogical for am.
Di kind intercourse wey dey between ideology and ignorance no dey follow logic.
Dem consider murder as di sin wey dealy pass for Igbo land.
In fact, for di old days if dem committe murder, di community go proceed on many days of cleansing of di land and atonement for di crime.
Wetin change now?
plenty pipo don assume dat di Igbo are natively no dey violence and dat dey cannot in any circumstances dey take innocent lives violently.
Di Igbo pipo dey very peaceful, but wetin dey apun recently inside South-east don make us to dey doubt di assumption 
All di regions inside di kontiri don dey marginalise as regards say di equitable distribution of resources to di pipo.
To dey clear, nah evri region don dey marginalise
Di statement wey dey more factual go be all Nigerians wey dey di bottom rung of di social ladder dey marginalise.
Nah Nigerians be victims of di carnivory of di elite.
E no mata say dem com from di North or di south.
Nah all of us be victims of elite conspiracy e no mata wia we kom from.
E dey so agonising say di scion of di south-east don dey turn dia region into Aleppo inside Syria. 
Nah who bring war and violence into im own home?
As of 2019, di south-east dey reputed say e dey very safe pass any oda region for inside Nigeria.
E dey very buoyant and dey well fared on top di development inside index.
All of dat don dey tremble down.
Di kilin of police officers some of dem Igbo di targeting of northern residents; di destruction of property and arsoning of police stations dem be di tragedies wey no suppose apun.
Dem dey fed di cancer and dem allow am spread throughout di bodi. 
Di Igbo dem nourish dis beast wey dey gnawing at dia groin. 
Wen dem start di serial murder of police officers, some clap for di effort of dia kilers on di inscrutable assumption say di police dey inside cahoots wit criminals to destroy Igbo land.
Now, di destruction of di region no dey for di hands of some herdsmen or bandits, but for di might of di sons of di land.
How you wan take define irony?
Dem dey threaten di Igbo pipo wey get different opinions to di group sentiments wit violence.
Dem no know di Igbo to get strong head or conscripted into tyranny of opinions and actions
Dem know Igbo to be republican; dem dey open to robust arguments and dem dey subject evri thought to scrutiny.
Wetin com change?
He be like say di kilin of police officers inside di south-east bin don dey unmitigated and security agencies don appear to don leave di pipo to dia own fate.
Armed robber dem don return at scale.
Nah dis be pipo lamentation evriwia.
A lady wey share her experience of how a mechanic wey she pay upfront to fix her car inside  Anambra runaway wit di moni and automobile, and even threatened her while im dey brag, police no dey inside di south-east again.
Jaguda don take control of interest areas inside di region.
Fear and wahala dey evriwia. 
Life don bikom nasty, brutish and short inside a region wey dey peaceful before.
As a mata of fact, we dey on a familiar path albeit dey dangerous
Di signs dey very tragic
Pikin wey dem born for Nigeria in 2000 fit tell how Boko Haram take start inside North-east.
Di militant groups dey ourys target di security agents and formations eviritime.
Wen dey take dem out, di pipo no go fit defence demselves and di armed gangs go start a new order of violence.
 Dem don kill securities and dem destroy security facilities in di South-east now
Afta di security scaffold don dey decimated, innocent pipo wey dey live di area and even those wey dey satisfied ova di revelry of blood fit bikom di next victims.
Dem be displaced persins wey dey live inside IDP camps for inside part of Eboyi state displace, dis apun as a result of interncine clashes among communities.
Wit di kin prevailing savagery wey di secessionist group, there go be more refugee problem inside south-east if dem continue wit di attack.
wia dey wan put pipo wey be say wetin dem dey do nah buying and selling?
we no fit end dis barbarity if we no agree
If some pipo choose to keep native sympathies for pipo wey dey take innocent lives, how go fit stop di bloodletting stop?
E dey for our hand.
Marwa don meet wit IGP, tok say Buhari don demand mopping up of dugs wey no dey legal.
President Muhammadu Buhari dan order di National Drug Law  Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) make dem mop up all drugs wey no dey legal and substances inside di kontiri make Nigeria bikom a drug-safe haven.
Mohammed Buba Marwa (Retd) tok for Wednesday inside Abuja wen im host di acting Inspector General of Police, Alkali Baba Usman.
dis dey as im urge di police to hand over drugs wey dey no dey  legal and make dem arrest suspects wey dey in connection wit drug trafficking to di NDLEA for prosecution as e no fall under Police jurisdiction.
Im also tok say dat within three months, di agency don seize ova two million kgs of assorted drugs wey be say the value at N80bn.
According to wetin im tok, di agency don arrest 2,100 criminals wey dey associated wit di illicit trade and dem don secure ova 350 convictions so far.
So far, we know say about 15 million Nigerians dey use drug, number dey very high and we dey work on di mandate wey di President give us to mop up all illicit substances and make Nigeria bikom a drug-safe haven, di NDLEA don remain upstanding by radiating up our activities.
within three months, we don seize ova 2 million kilogrammes of assorted drugs.
We don seized dis drugs to di value of N80bn, we do arrest 2,100 criminals wey dey associated wit dis illicit trade and we don secure ova 350 convictions so far.
We stil dey count by di grace of God
Some of our officers dem dey involve in seizures of drugs wich dey okay.
But dem suppose hand over to NDLEA afta dat.
Marwa tok say nah very few pipo proceed wit prosecuting those cases, dem no suppose do am since nah NDLEA dey in charge.
While dem dey seek make dem join bodi wit di police for di next phase of flushing out drug barons, im express optimism say more of dis barons dem go kom into di agency net.
We belive say di NPF go support us wit intelligence tracking, e dey possible say di NPF don alredy do am.
We ask for slot for inside police institutes so we fit bikom beneficiaries.
We go appoint liaison officer between us so we go fit ensure  definite contact.
We need to dey renew di join bodi wey dey between us bikos di use of drugs don dey confirmed as a major precursor to criminal activities  wey dey inside Nigerial.
Marwa tok say nah dis time dem suppose join bodi more. 
As im dey speak ealier, IGP recall say im bin Borno State Police Public Relation Officer for dat time.
Nah Marwa be di Military Administrator.
Experience nah im be di best teacher, you don dey for dis business of crime prevention and control. 
We dey here to declare to you my unalloyed cooperation.
We go join bodi and synergize wit di angency so we go fit police dis kontiri. 
For evri crime, we dey always get issue of drug.
Usman tok say if we fit synergize, cooperate and join, e go dey very beneficial to Nigerians and law enforcement as a whole.

Im talk say di decision nah to help decongest Pus and to give dem volters a healthy environment wey dey fit exercise dia civic responsibilities durring election
Prof Shehu tok say, There bin ova five million registered voters for inside Kano State, with 8,074 PUs and 3,148 VPs.
if dem approve am, Kano go have a total number 11,222 pus.

Okoye tok say, di last time INEC created new Pus nah for 1996 wen we get only 50 million voters wey dey registered

Im clare am say di exercise no go fit add to number of voters wey dey registered.

For crop season, dem go commot animal for farm
Even sef, many animal wey dey na em be say na di host community get dem
Dis kind thing wey dey see for South, along Iseyin-Igangan area for Oyo State, for Adada-Nkpologu-Adani- Iggah axis for Enugu State and along Awgu-Nkanu-Abakaliki axis in Ebonyi State make we use mouth tok small.
Many of diz dem pastoralist dey follow law well well, dem dey speak di local language, dia pikin dey school, dia wife dey sell market and dem dey do things for inside di community
If dem ban open grazing e go pafuka di system and e go uproot diz producer dem
And na di reson be dis
Ban for open grazing mean say dem dey change from agropastoralism to zero grazing system wey dem call turkey
For zero grazing, na stall dem dey keep animal and na different different thing dem dey use feed dem so make dem fir produce plenty milk.
local cow dey consume 2.5% of em bodi weight and dey consume about 15liter of water
Di average herd size of agropastoralist dem be between 20-35 animal
For cow wey be 200kg, herder go need cut 100kg grass and find 200 liter of water evriday
Na impossible task e be
So, pipo wey dey do cattle business wey also dey law abiding get two option, make dem stay and lose wetin dey give dem livelihood or make dem leave town
