Banks assets don declare and corruption war
If u dey plan to buy correct seed, make u find di ones wey get SEEDCODEX tag by di National Agricultural Seed Council (NASC).
Di SEEDCODEX tag na electronic seed verification and authentication system wey dey attached to every seed pack.
Farmers go fit scratch am and send di code to one numba for verification.
Di Director General of di council, Dr Phillips Ojo, tok dis for Abuja wen e dey follow tori-pipo yarn about di readiness of di agency to provide quality and certified seeds for di 2020/2021 plantin season.
Awa call to farmers na say only di seeds wey get di NASC SEEDCODEX tag fall for dis category and na im make dem buy from dia seed suppliers.
Di SEEDCODEX tag, as u know, na di result of di NASC electronic seed verification and authentication system wey go enhance di efficiency of awa seed certification and quality assurance program wey we establish to prevent seed adulteration by greedy seed merchants.
Farmers suppose know say all di certified seeds packs for Nigeria must get dis authentication tags wit di code on dem, so farmers go fit send di code to immediately verify if di seed wey dem buy na original and dem go fit report any mago-mago seed dealer for di national seed business to NASC, Dr Ojo yarn.
Melania Trump chief of staff don resign
Stephanie Grisham, wey be chief of staff of U.S. First Lady Melania Trump, don tok say she dey resign immediately.
Grisham na former White House tok-tok pesin and longtime pesin of Mrs Trump.
She  tok say na honour e be for her to serve di Trump administration.
Grisham no give any reason for her decision.
We still neva know weda her resignation na becos of di attack on di Capitol by pipo wey dey support outgoing president Donald Trump.
Traffickers hide drugs for inside statue of Blessed Virgin Mary
Drug traffickers wey dey find easy way to smuggle illegal drugs don follow di religious route as dem load di statue of di Blessed Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus wit drugs.
NDLEA operatives wey dem plant for two courier companies seize di drugs wey dem hide inside di statue, and som odas for inside motor spare parts wey dem wan ship go Canada and  UAE.
About 140 grammes of methamphetamine wey dem wan send go Philippines, inside di statue of Mary na im officers seize for one of di courier company.
Anoda 500 grammes of heroin wey dem dey send go Canada for inside motor spare parts na im dem seize for di second courier company.
Accordin to Mr Femi Babafemi wey be di director of media and advocacy for NDLEA, dem seize anoda two separate package of Indian hemp wey dem wan send go UAE. 3.1kg wey dem hide inside spices and anoda one kilogramme wey dey inside local herbs. 
For anoda development, di NDLEA for different sting operation arrest 31 suspects for Ondo State, unto say dem catch dem wit 276 kg of assorted illegal drugs.
Som of dose wey dem arrest na seven female.
Dem arrest dem durin a two-week raid wey begin for April 6.
Babafemi tok say dem do di sting operations to stop di rate of drug abuse wey dey increase among youths and even di elderly for Ondo State.
E add am join say di illegal drugs wey dem seize na 74.285kgs of Indian hemp, 267 grammes of oda psychotropic substance;
201kgs of skuchies (combination of Indian hemp, tramadol, ethanol, and Zobo).
NDLEA scatter or destroy most of di spots wia dem dey sell di drugs. E yarn.
Inside Akwa Ibom, di NDLEA also seize 62.150kg of illegal drugs for Oron and Uyo.
Babafemi yarn wetin di NDLEA commander for di state, Obot Bassey tok, say na four suspect dem arrest inside two sting operations wey dem do for April 22 and April 23.
E tok am say di NDLEA chairman, retired Brig.-Gen.
Buba Marwa, don commend di operatives for di two states and dose wey dey Operations and General Investigations Directorate for Lagos on dia steadfastness.
Pastor Adefarasin; if Nigeria na scam; den all of us na scammers
Na di compulsory duty of everi citizen to hold di government to account.
In fact, citizenship na call to duty for di state.
And no compulsory duty wey pass make citizens dey scrutinize and monitor dia employees  di government frequently.
Criticising di government na part of di rights of everi citizen, and active citizenship get to do wit takin di governmentthroughe pace.
No government wey dem no dey criticise, and no government too special for pipo to criticise.
But, we need differentiate between any government and Nigeria as a kontri.
Government go kom and go, but Nigeria go remain.
We need understand say Nigeria na di pipo wey dey inside.
So, wen we belittle di kontri, we just dey shoot awasef for leg.
If we tok say Nigeria na scam, indirectly wetin we mean be say, Nigerians be scammers.
Nigeria no be scam, like som of dose wey dey abuse di nation dey always tok, unknowingly; Na we turn Nigeria to anytin wey e be.
Nigeria no be just a place somwia.
Nigeria na di pipo.
Di gud, di bad and di ugly  na we make am be laidat.
Anytin wey dey affect di kontri, na we be di agent wey cause am.
If Nigeria na scam as Pastor Paul Adefarasin tok, den we all be scammers.
Even say I agree, say Adefarasin anger na becos of di love wey e get for di kontri, im comment say Nigeria na scam and fraud no dey reasonable. 
If Nigeria na fraud; den all of us be fraudster, leaders and followers join.
All of us don contribute to di dissapointment of di entity.
We dey live for a kontri wia pastors dey run dia ministry like business.
Dem dey run am like business enterprise but dem no dey pay tax for dere.
CAMA; Government introduce a law wey go regulate di business undertaking of di religious industry and wey go bring som transparency and accountability inside di spiritual business.
But na pastors dey against dis law pass.
Still, na dis same pipo wey no wan follow di law be di loudest voice wen dem dey pass capital sentence on Nigeria.
Funny tin be say, dis pastors dey follow di law of oda kontri dey run dia church for dose kontri.
Dem dey submit dia finance for regular check by di authorities for UK, US and oda places.
But for Nigeria dem dey live above di law.
Pastor Chris Oyakhilome don dey spread harmful lies about COVID vaccine.
E claim say na di concoction of di anti-Christ.
Dem fine am 125,000 pounds for Uk, sake of say e dey tok harmful and unsubstantiated tins about di vaccine.
But for Nigeria wia e dey kontinue to bring different COVID conspiracy, dem neva call am to kom explain im offence, sake of say na man of god e be. 
Maybe na why Nigeria be scam.
If Nigeria na scam, den na becos of pastors wey dey siddun for top, kom dey step on di law wey dey govern di land.
If Nigeria na fraud, den na becos of pastors wey dey sign agreement wit politicians everi election period; dey campaign for dem on di altar, dey command di demons of hell untop dose wey no gree accept dia anointed candidate.
Clergymen dey as corrupt as di politikal class.
Also, civil servant, wey dey collect N150,000 per month, but get pikin for UK school, and property for all ova di major cities of di kontri, go abuse Nigeria and carry all im hypocrisy put for lamentation and insult to di state.
E go calm down ignore e own contribution for di corruption wey dey destroy di kontri.
Also, som citizens dey reject laws, rules and regulations.
Wia traffic light dey, dem go ignore am; wia protocol dey, dem go bypass am, and for places wia dem don get standard for gud service delivery and operations, dem go abandon am.
Still, all of dem go blame Nigeria for di bad status quo as if say di kontri dey exist witout di pipo.
Di problem wey Nigeria get na pipo problem.
But di bad tin be say nobodi wan take responsibility for di terrible way wey tins be.
We dey blame di Nigeria wey no exist.
Na all of us get hand for inside di bad situation of Nigeria.
Instead make we dey follow di tin wey we don conclude about Nigeria, make we forsee goodness and positivity into di system, and make we dey work to make awa kontri di tin wey we want make e be.
Nigeria go be wetin we want make e be.
Di politicians get comma.
But dat na di reason why new generation of leaders must come up and take kontrol.
Nobodi fit free awa mind except us.
Citizenship na call to duty.
NIGERIA NO BE SCAM.
Why separation no be di Silver Bullet to Nigeria challenges
Di principle of self-determination as e dey for di UN charter wey awa pipo wey wan separate hold-on to, take effect for a time wey many pipo for di world dey under colonial yoke or oda form of kontrol by outside power.
Di principle na to give chance to independence and liberation movements so dem go fit gain dia freedom and determine dia path of future development.
For di world wey we dey today, dis principle only apply to few pipo, becos majority of di world don dey free from colonial kontrol and sef-governing.
So dem go need adjust di principle of sef-determination, wey dem establish under di UN charter, so e go fit accommodate di demand of awa pipo wey wan separate, becos if we follow wetin dey dere, dem no qualify.
First of all, dem go need to prove carefully and convincingly say di area wey dem claim to represent dey under som form of kontrol, and say dem dey lack di basic freedom wey everibodi suppose enjoy as e dey di UN charter.
And for wia dem wan prove dat one, dem go need convince di UN on di steps wey dem don take, from di national (National Assembly), sub-regional (ECOWAS) and continental level (AU) to present dia case.
And di UN no go just take dia word laidat.
Dem go get committee wey go confam di fact to know weda true-true, Nigeria as a kontri dey practise di basic requirement of demokracy or not.
Dem don even complicate di case wit di fact say dose areas no be area wey dem dey fight untop, and no be area wey dey under any trusteeship wey go need UN referendum to give dem direct independence or ask dem who dem wan join inside di pipo wey dey fight untop di place. 
If our secessionists cannot provide these basic requirements, the farthest their case could get within the UN system will predictably be the waste paper basket because the UN is not for frivolities.
E no dey give chance make som movement wey no know wetin dem dey about abuse im wide and transparent process. 
Di case of marginalisation, wey dem mention as part of di reason for separation, dey too simple to waste awa time untop.
Na everi democratik system dey get winner and loser for election.
And as awa politikal system no perfect reach, di konstitution make am compulsory say as many ethnic group and geo-political zones as possible must get representative for government and im institutions.
E go tough for di pipo wey wan separate to convince di outside world say dia case of marginalisation dey more compelling pass dat of more dan 300 oda ethnic group wey dey Nigeria.
Wetin dis one mean be say, why di international community, wey di pipo wey wan separate dey report and seek support from go single out jus two out of like hundred of dat kind case wey dey ring for di Nigerian media say na im dem go work on ?
What makes their cases so special and urgent above those of others in Nigeria who have conversely chosen not to follow the path of secession?
Out of all di three tins wey make awa secessionists dey agitate, no one dey convincing or compelling enough to justify dia action.
On di amalgamation argument, Nigeria own no be special case for Afrika or for di world.
If Nigeria go need break up unto say Britain no join am well, den dis go be di case of almost all di kontris for Afrika.
In short, if dem use dis principle, e go start di course to begin a new scramble for Africa by di old and upcoming world powers, and like befor, na Afrikans go be di victim.
Make we no deceive awasef, becos if di break-up of Nigeria happun (God forbid), e go lead to di birth of kontris
wey go dey weak sotey, dem go dey beg from di foreign powers.
We don get som argument wey dey compare di break up of Nigeria wit dat of Eastern European states and di Balkans.
Untop dis one, e go beta make we undastand well say di tin wey work for Europe fit no work for Africa.
In di case of di kontris wey we mention, na part of di great geo-strategic games of di major world powers wey get direct cultural, economik and politikal link and interest for di emerging scenario.
And dis kontris don get clear boundary befor dem agree to kom togeda for mutual defence durin di uncertain situation of di Second World War.
Immediately di Soviet order, wey join dem togeda begin dey scatter, all dis kontris need go back to di status quo ante.
And, more importantly, dis developments get di backing and guarantee of di important powers for Europe and di world.
Se Nigerian secessionists get dat kind recognition and profile in di face of di principal powers of di world wey go make dem answer dem?
Surely, di answer na zero.
Dis no kom mean say di agitation of pipo to separate for di kontri no get som gud reason.
Anybodi wey dey live for dis kontri wit dis rising case of insecurity, poverty, corruption, nepotism, economic uncertainty and di unbelievable incompetence and near criminal indifference of di government to dis challenges go conclude say truly, we dey for a kontri wey dey fail for im basic konstitutional duties and responsibilities.
And for a fragile kontri like awa own, wey get plenti fault, e dey normal for tendency or preference for separation to arise and grow fast wit di clear dysfunctionality of di government wey dey.
And na everybodi get dis dis feeling.
But as discouragin as di outlook be, and as temptin as di outcome dey appear, separation no fit be di solution to awa current challenge as a nation.
Indeed na prospect wey get som unknown dangers, danger wey no be for di secessionists alone but for di kontri as a whole.
Nigeria no dey perfect.
Even som of di advance kontris don show say despite dia years of existence and dia gud systems, dem no dey free from crises wey dey kom from internal conflict.
Make we no dey deceive awasef say as we dey try break up awa kontri, som kontris go graciously assist us.
Wetin dem go do na to give us di means to destroy and weaken awasef, so dem go fit benefit while we go suffer am. 
Na di truth about di international system be dat.
As di popular German beamter tok for di beginnin of my paper; Na we be awa own problem and solution join togeda.
We need put awa mind, talent and effort togeda to develop Nigeria instead say we wan breaking am.
Fidelity celebrate Children Day wit N9.3m money gift to dia customers
To celebrate dis year Children Day, Fidelity Bank pay N150,000 to 62 pipo wey get Sweet Account (SWEETA) tru-out di kontri, wey be di total of N9.3 millionthroughdia savings loyalty programme wey dey go on.
Di bank present cheque to di beneficiaries for different children events for Katsina, Niger, Abuja and Lagos.
About di initiative, Fidelity Bank CEO, Mrs Nneka Onyeali-Ikpe, tok say all-round quality education na im be di strong way to train di children of tomorrow and to train special children who go fit compete wit odas for di world. 
Na why we don decide to contribute awa own as a bank, by giving school fees support to selected Nigerian children.
Di bank don dash out N4.1bn to 10,280 customers since dem start di loyalty programme till today.
Investin in young pipo: Ahmed Bobboi example
For July, 2017, I get di honour to spend one evenin inside one British bank wey dem dey call Coutts, as part of di plenti activity wey dey for us as di 2017 Queen's Young Leaders.
U fit dey wonder say why I go dey write about event wey I go for place wey dry like bank.
Anyway, Coutts no be ordinary bank.
Apart from say na one of di eight oldest bank for di world (dem start am som 329 years ago for 1692), Coutts na private bank wey dey popular for im big customers like Her Majesty di Queen.
Inside di big hall, na two welcome us under a big dome for di centre of di building.
Na sharp-sharp I recognise one of di two men wey stand wit a familiar wide smile.
Na Sir John Major, befor-befor British Prime Minister and Chairman of di Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust.
We don meet befor, for one dinner wey dem organize for us for di Australian High Commission wey dey London, and na dere e congratulate us for awa recognition by Her Majesty.
Dem introduce di oda man to us as Lord William Waldegrave of North Hill. Na im be di Chairman of di Board of Coutts Bank and Chairman of di Royal Mint Advisory Committee.
Dat evening dey full of entertainment; eatin and drinkin. E sweet well-well
But apart from di display and glamour, we tok and gist wit Lord Waldegarve and Sir Major, two outstandin leaders for di United Kingdom (UK).
Dem show dia happiness to celebrate awa achievement, and dem describe us as special pipo. Dem encourage us to develop awa skills more and create long legacy for awa kontri and di Commonwealth togeda.
Afta, I follow Sir Major and Lord Wadegrave yarn for private, I ask dem som question about public service, banking and finance, innovation and young pipo generally.
I learn a lot of tins from dem
and I komot for Coutts.
Dat night seriously inspire and motivate me more as a change agent, innovator and young leader for Nigeria.
Weda u dey for government, or u dey business, and especially as innovator or entrepreneur, I no fit tok am finish, how important dis kind inspiration fit be for di work wey u dey do.
Som pipo fit komot face for dis confirmation say e no dey relevant. Dem don forget how dis kind tok fit be beta way of mentorship and motivation for upcomin leaders, and e fit serve as example for dem to see champions among pipo wey be like dem.
Di feeling of validation and motivation, wit guidance and support na necessary ingredient for everi leader, especially young pipo.
Di earlier awa older generation for Nigeria realise and accept dis culture of support and mentorship wit dia full chest, and truly celebrate awa achievements, di beta e go be for di future of dis kontri and di growin population of young pipo.
Make u forgive my digression.
Di reason why I dey narrate dis experience na say, since wey e don happun, I no experience dat kind tin again, until recently wen I siddun wit anoda public servant for Nigeria, di Executive Secretary of di Petroleum Equalisation Fund
(Management) Board (PEF-M-B), Alhaji Ahmed A Bobboi.
Even say oil and gas no be my main industry of discipline or practice, I get strong opinion say make pesin no sabi am dey very careless since di contribution of di sector to revenue
pass any oda sector for di kontri.
So I don dey try sabi wetin dey happun for di industry, even say I want make we shift and focus on non-oil sources of income.
I dey happy say I get di opportunity to yarn wit a crucial stakeholder like di executive, especially becos di organisation na pacesetter for di use of advance technology to improve efficiency and performance for di sector.
Howeva, wetin I gain from dis experience even dey more valuable pass my understanding of di industry more.
We discuss difrent topic; from history to government, and from job creation to innovation and entrepreneurship.
E dey very excitin and refreshin, and e carry me straight go Coutts again.
I meet Mr Bobboi for di first time wen I join one team wey e follow kontrol, we dey work untop one regional entrepreneurship acceleration programme under di supervision of Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) wia different community for di world join MIT for evidence-based practical approach to make di entrepreneurial ecosystems strongthroughinnovation.
I dey suprised by di vision and dedication wey dis go bring for PEF-M-B to dey involve for dis project, as e surely dey visionary and more beneficial to help build a formidable entrepreneurial ecosystem wit partner like MIT pass di ordinary Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) programme wey most organization dey do, wey no dey get impact most times. 
For dat particular encounter wey I get wit am, we yarn about awa two-years programme wit MIT and di big responsibility of truly acceleratin entrepreneurial development as remedy to lack of jobs and catalyst for prosperity.
The He spoke about various pain points for him as a leader and the approach to solve them.
One of di wonderful takeaway wey I collect na im idea about di National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) and how we fit use am serve young graduates and di nation beta.
Becos e don dey notice say som corps members wey dey serve for PEF-M-B dey always dey idle, di executive secretary tok say e don dey find way to ensure say di corp members no just dey engaged, but say dem komot wit skills and knowledge wey go last, and wey go give dem career wey pass government job.
Part of dis go be to do one big programme wey go turn dem to entrepreneurs wey get passion for innovation,througha dedicated and well planned innovation and enterprise trainin durin dia service year for PEF-MB.
Di honesty and sincere disposition of Mr. Bobboi dey visible and penetrating truout awa discussion and me sef kom get di strong will to do my best, no be only to kontinue dey innovate for different sector but to also dey ensure kontinuity for di inspiration and support of younger leaders and innovators, wey go fit make all di difference for awa dear kontri Nigeria.
Lagos LG polls: Aspirants go face direct primary as consensus option don fail
In preparation of di July local government election for Lagos State, di rulin All Progressives Congress (APC) go conduct open primary for aspirants wey dey di 20 local government areas (LGs) and 37 local council development areas (LCDAs), Daily Trust report.
Howeva, we hear say som local governments dey wia dem don agree to use di consensus option.
Awa tori-pesin hear am yesterday say di decision to use open primary na becos di aspirants no gree step down for demsef, plus di tension and unrest wey dey among di LG chapters.
We go rememba say 1050 aspirants wey be di combination of 250 chairmanship and 800 councillorship aspirant dey contest for di 434 positions wey dey di 57 LGs.
Di party don dey for confusion untop plenti aspirants, as dem dey set up screening committee wey  go dey unda di supervision of di Deputy Governor, Dr Obafemi Hamza. 
As at wen we dey write dis report, aspirants dey wait anxiously for di result of di screenin.
One local government chairman wey dey contest for second term, yarn wit awa tori-pesin for chat, e tok say open primary go happun on Saturday, May 29, 2021, and say im dey ready to face two oda aspirants wey dey challenge am for di ticket.
Daily Trust make us know say di party don already give di aspirants guideline befor di open primary wey go happun for local government wia consensus no fit happun. 
As e dey for di guideline wey Daily Trust see, Accredited members go use open ballot vote for di venue, dem go stand for front of di poster of di candidate wey dem like, and
di candidate wey get di highest numba of votes na im dem go announce as di winner.
Afta di popular report say di APC National Leader and strongman for Lagos politics, Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu don endorse som candidate, di former governor don deny di claim, say im no get candidate wey im prefer.
For one chat wit Daily Trust, di Publicity Secretary of di state Caretaker Committee, Seye Oladejo tok say, di guidelines dey clear, say na open direct primary make dem do.
Di party dey strongly committed to internal demokracy and dem provide a level playin ground for all aspirants.
UK MPS want make dem Boycott 2022 Winter Olympics for Beijing 
Request don dey plenti untop say make pipo boycott di 2022 Winter Olympics, sake of say dem accuse China for human right abuse, especially for di Xinjiang region against di Muslim pipo of Uyghur.
Di evidence say genocide don dey happun for western China dey veri clear, sotey di UK and di whole world go need stand up against Beijing and use everi tin wey dey available to stop am.  Ed Davey, di leader of di Liberal Democrats, and Labour MP Chris Bryant, one member of di foreign affairs select committee and one befor-befor junior foreign minister write on top di Liberal Democrats website dis month.
We need rememba wen we no gree stand up against human rights abuse for di past, and rememba di image from British sportin history like di England football team,
Nazi salute for di 1930s and di rebel cricket tour to South Africa for di 1980s, Davey yarn while e dey call on di government and di British Olympic Association to do somtin.
Team GB (Great Brittain), ParalympicsGB and di Government get moral responsibility to look at, so dem go know if make dem send dia team to dis Game
na di correct tin to do.
Di 2022 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games go be di propaganda tool for dat kind regime wey dey commit genocide, e tok.
Recently, di main opposition party for Canada, di Conservative Party, tell Prime Minister Justin Trudeau government say make dem pressure di International Olympic Committee say make dem carry di 2022 Winter Olympics komot for Beijing, say China dey commit genocide against more dan one million Uyghurs for Xinjiang.
Dis na afta 180 join-bodi of human rights group tell governments around di world say make dem boycott di Beijing Winter Olympic Games wey go start next year, sake of say China dey abuse di human right of minorities.
Di letter dey call on kontris say make dem no participate for di games and make dem no allow China use dem kontinue dia wicked abuse of rights and discipline on di minority. 
Di IOC tok for one statement say di committee policy for im organisin committee na to hear all di consign wey relate to di Olympic Games.
For di Beijing Winter Olympics specifically, di IOC tok say im Evaluation Committee don hear wetin plenti NGO tok, plus dia consign about human rights.
Di committee tok dia own stand on di mata, say dem agree wit groups say di IOC go need stay neutral on all global politikal issues. Even say e fit no agree wit di politikal structure, social circumstances or human right standard for im kontri. 
Howeva, China Foreign Ministry tok-tok pesin Wang Wenbin, tok say di request to boycott di Games dey veri irresponsible.
Di request to boycott next year winter Olympics kom afta Secretary of State, Antony Blinken tok say e agree wit wetin former President Donald Trump administration tok about di abuse of Uyghurs for China as genocide.
We dey work on post-harvest techs -Provost, Kano Agric College
Dr Halima Alimi wey be di Acting Provost, Federal College of Agricultural Produce Technology (FCAPT), Kano, tok say di institute go develop quality post-harvest technologies for di kontri.
Alimi yarn tori-men for Kano say di new management of di institution don adopt proactive programmes to encourage research and create enablin teachin and learnin environment for di growth of post-harvest processin.
She tok say di management dey committed to change di narrativethroughdi introduction of new preservation technologies, reduce waste and boost agricultural processin.
We go make sure say sanity dey among di staff and students, we go improve on staff development so dem go fit get a conducive workin and learnin environment.
As she yarn, di college dey do Ordinary National Diploma (OND) and Higher
National Diploma  (HND) programme for different aspect of agriculture.
Awa focus na on post-harvest science; how we fit handle agricultural produce afta we don harvest am, and dis include storage, preservation and processin.
Dis na di only school for di kontri wey get dis mandate, she tok.
Sake of dis, di provost dey encourage farmers say make dem use di innovations and oda tins wey di college dey do take improve dia productivity.
Shool Fees Increase: Police prevent protest for Kaduna Government House
Police and State Vigilante Srvice prevent di students of Kaduna State University wey dey protest, on Tuesday say make dem no enta di government house.
Di students dey protest becos of di school fees wey di state government increase.
Daily Trust observe say di angry students dey sing solidarity songs as dem dey march go di government house, befor police kom block dem for road.
Heavily armed police officers for inside vehicle, and vigilantes wey dey operate under KADVIS na im we see for main road dey monitor, while di students siddun ontop floor for di middle of di road.
U go rememba say di state government and management of di university don refuse to reverse di money, even say students and parents for di state dey beg.
One of di student representative, Comrade Auba Mohammed, tok say dem dey march go di government house to just go submit letter of complaint give Governor Nasir El-Rufai.
E yarn say majority of dem be orphan and dia parents no fit pay for dem.
Zimbabwea VP don resign untop allegation of sexual misconduct
Vice President of Zimbabwe, Kembo Mohadi don resign on Monday untop allegations of sexual misconduct. E tender e apology for di work wey e no do well.
Na since last month local news stations don dey roar wit audio recordings of fone conversation wia Mohadi dey ask different women for sex, one of dem wey be im junior for office.
Di recordings first show for online publication, ZimLive website , Inside di audio, you fit hear wia one man dey book appointment for sex inside im office. 
I dey step down as di Vice President of di Republic of Zimbabwe wit immediate effect, di 71-year-old leader tok for inside one letter wey dem post for di ministry of information 
I don decide to komot for office, no be sake of say I be coward, but unto say I get respect for di office of di presidency, so dem no go fit compromise am, or represent am wit actions wey dey connected to my challenges as a pesin.
I don dey reflect and tink about mysef, and I see say I need space wey I go take deal wit my problems outside governance. E yarn
E repeat am say im no do any bad tin, say im be victim of information distortion, voice cloning, and sponsored spooking wit political sabotage.
Mohadi, wey be retired soldier and foreman of di kontri liberation war, na one of di  two vice presidents for Zimbabwe.
E don serve for different ministerial position under befor-befor president, Robert Mugabe and dem kom appoint am as vice president for 2017 afta dem komot Mugabe.
Technology don make professional farmers for China strong.
Human resources dey veri important for China rural vitalization.
Currently, na more dan 17 million high-class farmers dey work for villages, so dem go fit improve di rural areas.
Di knowledge of science wey Chinese farmers get don lay solid foundation for dia general development and e dey give stronger support for di kontri rural economy.
Bao Yuan na young man wey get aquatic product company wey e establish 2014 for Qujing, Yunnan province for southwest China afta e graduate from Yunnan Normal University for 2014.
E tok say "Artificial breedin no just dey give pipo option of different choice, e also dey protect different kind of fish wey don dey komot for water.
Song Xueqin na Gen Y female wey don get name for North China Lvliang Mountains,
for Shanxi province sake of say she sabi different flat peach graftin technique.
Afta she graduate from college, Song don do different businness like catering, gypsum processin and rearing of sheep, but she no make am for any of dis business.
For 2009, she hear say dem fit turn Chinese wild peach to flat peachthroughgraftin, na so she tell one of her friend say make dat one help am bring flat peach scion from di independent Uygur region, Xinjiang province of Northwest China. Afta, she invite one expert say make e kom teach am di tins wey she need to know. 
Afta 1 year, Song and her husband graft flat peach scions on more dan 4,000 wild peach for one hillside near Hetaozhang village, Fenxi County, for Shanxi province, but di result no good.
Afta she konsult di relevant materials and experts, she finally realize wetin cross-pollination be.
Di yield go only go up wen di type wey dem join togeda match. She yarn.
Last year, di woman collect di first certificate for her life, a certificate for new professional farmers.
Rural areas no dey eva lack resources.
Recently, as pipo standard of living dey high, dem dey get larger demand for fresh and high-quality agricultural products.
Zuo Chenming wey be senior researcher for  AliResearch, a research branch of Alibaba Group tok say "Dis trend dey make more and more educated entrepreneurs wey get technical skill and know how to do businesses, to go back to di rural area.
For early morning, Mi Xiaohong from Yuzhong County, Lanzhou, Gansu province for Northwest China start work for cowshed, she dey clean di cowshed, and give di cow new feed and water. 
E no easy to make cow feed, becos we need calculate how many grass and oda materials wey we go add for inside. We go need to know di ratio of bran, glacial flour and salt, wey go dey inside. She tell People's Daily, say dem go need dey adjust di ingredients wey dey inside di as di cow dey grow. 
Mi, dey always go trainin programs wey di County government organise, and she don turn specialist for cattle husbandry.
I divert plenti times wen I still be novice, but now my fellow villagers dey always come meet me for advice. She add am join say, na onlythroughkontinuous learnin she go fit solve more problems.
Today, local authorities all ova China don dey give new policy and technique to make sure say farmers study new technologies.
Shandong province don begin one professional title evaluation system for professional farmers, and Jiangsu province Kunshan dey offer free college education for professional farmers.
For Gansu Province, dem dey organise trainin session for di leaders of professional cooperative and coordinators of animal epidemic prevention. All dis na effort to bring technology to di farm and find solution to agric problems.
2023: Group Begin #BringBackGEJ project, pledge to fund campaign
A group under di sponsorship of Youths Earnestly Demand For
Goodluck E.Jonathan (YED4GEJ 2023) don tell former President Goodluck Jonathan say make e contest for di 2023 presidential election.
Jonathan wey lose power to di candidate of befor-befor opposition party, All Progressives Congress (APC), Gen. Muhammadu Buhari (rtd) for di 2015 general election. Dis na im end di 16 years wey People's Democratic Party (PDP) don dey rulefor di kontri.
Di National Chairman of di group, Prince Teddy Omiloli and National Director Operations, Comrade Douye Daniel tok on Sunday for inside one statement say, dem get hope say Jonathan go tackle di challenges wey torment di kontri if dem give am di power.
Di group explain say Jonathan don see di reason why we need to restructure Nigeria wen e dey power, and na why e organise national confab for 2014, but dem no allow am implement am, sake of say dem komot am for office. Na why we need give am anoda chance.
Right now, wen we check di ideology and activity of awa present politicians, di youth and elders join togeda, we see say Goodluck Jonathan wey be true democrat, nation builder, and leader of integrity wey get beta goal na im get di solution to di problem wey dey face Nigeria presently.
E (Jonathan) don prove say e fit sacrifice anytin to ensure di unity, peace and development of awa great nation Nigeria.
We, as youths of dis great nation, afta we don discover Nigeria problem, and we don see say Goodluck Jonathan na di solution, we dey call on all Nigerians, plus awa politikal elites, present administration and religious leaders say make dem join di call for Goodluck Ebele Jonathan to kom back and make dem also join awa #BringbackGEJ project.
We di youths dey ready to buy President Jonathan form for any party wey e choose to contest from, and we go fund im campaign from di beginnin to di end, once e don accept dis divine call. Di group tok.
Rice sufficiency: Nigeria get long way to go Expert
Dr Philip Idinoba, wey be rice commodity specialist for AfricaRice, don show im consign untop di increasin population wey dey affect Federal Government effort to boost rice production.
Idinoba yarn dis one for interview wit News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) for Gombe on Tuesday.
E tok say government need to invest more on rice, so e go fit boost Nigeria food security.
As e yarn, di government dey do plenti tins to boost rice production, sake of say na staple food, but di growin population of di kontri dey bring down di effort. 
E tok say di rate of urbanisation, wey be one of di key factors of rice consumption for Nigeria, dey veri high pass di rate wey we take dey use plant rice.
Nigeria still get long way to go for rice sufficiency.
We dey make effort everi yearthroughdi Anchor Borrowers Programme, special intervention programme and oda donor funded projects.
All dis na to bring som tins wey go help farmers increase dia yield and productivity.
But even wit all dis Federal Government effort, di numba of new mouth wey dey join evri year cancel all dis improvement. Idinoba yarn.
Plenti tins to do
Di agronomist add am join say we need to do plenti tins by increasin awa investment, especially for dry season farmin.
As Idinoba tok, we fit take advantage of dry season farmin to boost rice productivity.
We go get beta result for rice production if we fit close di gaps wey dry season dey always cancel for rice cultivation.
E yarn say, if u get eight million farmers wey dey plant rice for wet season, and only two million out of dem dey plant rice for dry season, den di effort never reach yet.
Idinoba, wey still be water management specialist, advise farmers wey dey areas wit flood for di kontri say make dem plant di kind seed wey go fit tolerate flood and go fit survive for water between three to four weeks.
He tok am say All dis varieties, wey dem release three years ago, and still dey multiply by di National Seeds Council of Nigeria, wit oda seeds companies, dey available, and farmers go fit get am. 
Dis year, wit di kind tori wey we hear from farmers for Kebbi, Jigawa and Adamawa wey use dis kind varieties, u fit no get complete failure laidat.
Derefor, make we combine dis kind technology go help one way.
Di rice specialist add am say for dose kind areas, improvement go need dey di cropping environmentthroughdi construction of water structures to kontrol, retain or evacuate water.
Volleyball: JVC Bauchi get eye for Premier League ticket
Monday Dada wey be di Coach JVC volleyball club of Bauchi, don yarn say im team dey eager to collect promotion enta di Nigerian Premier League.
Di coach yarn dis one on Wednesday afta im side beat Oyo State 3-1 (25-23, 25-21, 28-30, 25-22) for di ongoin 2021 National Division 1 Volleyball League for Kaduna.
E tok say base on di kind players wey dey di team, JVC of Bauchi belong to di Premier League class.
JVC of Bauchi dey di Division 1 league, and dem go collect promotion enta next season premier league, unto say na dere di big guns dey, and na wetin we dey aim for be dat.
We no dey expect anytin more dan to get di ticket, e yarn.
Dada sef take responsibility for di failure of im team to beat Kwara State on Tuesday. E explain say na becos of im own technical mistakes.
For oda match wey dem play yestaday, Spartans Spikers of Yola lose 2-3 (21-25, 22-25, 25-17, 25-21, 12-15) to Kwara United, Katsina United flog Caliphate Spikers of Sokoto 3-1 (25-23, 25-19, 22-25, 25-12) while Kada Kings scatter Equity Spikers of Kebbi 3-0 (25-14, 25-15, 25-14).
Wetin Kano need for 2023
Kano need create new path to development for 2023.
Dis na becos di state don dey enta di pit of poverty.
Awa rich pre-colonial history show say na Kano rich pass for all di Hausa states, becos di state dey involve for di economy.
Even say di colonialists destroy di economic foundation of Kano and oda society wey dem colonise, di policy of di pipo wey lead di Native Authority from 1926 to 1963 contribute to make Kano remain as di leadin economic centre of Northern Nigeria.
For example, dem establish di first modern water treatment plant wey dey di region for 1931, di first independent power plant for Northern Nigeria, wey get 15MW, and for more dan 80 years, dem neva establish any one wey resemble am for Northern Nigeria.
Dem establish di first industrial estate wey dey di Northern Region, dem inherit only one primary school for 1926, and for 1963 everi village don get primary school (more dan hundred), dem establish secondary schools, dem no meet any hospital (except one dispensary) and for 1963 dem don build two general hospital and more dan hundred dispensaries for everi village.
Na dem lay di foundation of modern Kano.
Politikally, na dem make di NPC becom di rulin party for Nigeria.
From 1966 to 1979 and 1984 to 1999, Kano still maintain im position as di second to Lagos.
Kano no get kontrol ova macro-economic policy but e leaders fit provide di right environment for economic growth.
For example, di Dawanau Market, wey still be di biggest grain market for West Africa, e dey bring pipo from all part of di kontinent, even from far place like Gabon and Congo.
All dis na result of di foresight wey Alhaji Bashari Garko (may Allah bless im soul), wey establish di market get.
Di three administration wey don rule Kano from 1999 till today, fit claim say all of dem be di best tin wey don happun to Kano, but why Kano don reduce to numba nine for Nigeria?
One single project no dey wey don bring correct economic change for Kano, even afta plenti effort of consign pipo.
If di elite dey focus and determine, wit state leadership as e dey for di pre-colonial period, Kano no go go down to numba nine for Nigeria wit GDP of $13.30b afta Lagos ($46.03b), Rivers ($32.14b), Delta ($25.48b), Oyo ($21.64b), Imo ($20.64), Edo ($17.50b), Akwa Ibom ($15.26) and Ogun ($13.82).
If we no prevent am now, we no go fit imagine di disaster wey go kom in di next 10 years.
Dis na becos of many reasons. One of dem be say we get more dan four million pupils for public basic schools (primary and JSS) and by 2033 dem go don finish secondary education.
Assume say na onli 10 percent of dem (400,000) go go higher-level, di government go fit sponsor dia education?
Afta dem complete higher education, di economy go fit give dem beta employment?
As e be so, e no fit.
Dis na becos, more dan 250 medical doctors and more dan 1000 nurses wey di state government dey sponsor, na im dem no fit employ.
We go dey deceive awasef wit di skills acquisition programme wey dey train artisans wey no go get any job afta dem learn di skills, sake of say di local economy no fit employ dem.
Everi day we dey hear billions wey federal government allocate for one economic programme or di oda, and still, we no dey reason pass to train plumbers, carpenters, mechanics etc.
Since, awa idea no dey about how we go use resources employ di large population as Gajimasu (1095-1135) do wen e begin di city walls.
We need tink outside di box.
Kano no need genius wey get di best qualification and experience, or saint as di next governor.
Dis na becos di governors wey dey for di last 20 years get som of di best quality, and dem fit even don do dia best, but as all of us dey see, di result no be di best for di state.
So, we need reason outside di box.
Di two parties, APC and PDP no fit provide di kind leadership wey we want, sake of say na godfathers dey kontrol dem, and dem no get idea on wetin to do, but dia main focus na how to share di state resources.
Di best tin wey dem fit do na to negotiate for governor wey go serve di interest of a godfather or cabal.
So, di two parties no be di best option.
Beta pesin fit kom outside on e own, or wit di help of oda beta patriotic pipo.
E fit use any way win, even if e negotiate wit any of di two parties or anoda party sef.
E dey possible
E  don happun befor.
One example wey dey near us na Nasir Elrufai for Kaduna State.
Im be one of di best for im generation, but di security situation for di state don pass im power, sake of say e dey depend on im personal intelligence and capacity.
Pesin wey beta pass am for Kano no go make di place beta unless dem change som important tins. 
I no claim say I get all di answer or even say na me get all di idea wey dey down.
Som of dem na part of Aminu Kano idea.
Plenti beta idea dey for di mind of more intelligent pipo. 
Di idea wey I dey suggest na base on my small experience as labourer of politicians and som trainin wey I get outside dis kontri.
Right now, Kano dey crossroad, and dis ideas fit dey useful.
Som pipo need kom togeda to organise one political movement wey no dey in kontrol of anybodi but pipo wey wan sacrifice.
Make dem look di suggestion below:
Need dey for us to start political organisation at di lowest level and make sure say na di members dey in kontrol.
Material reward no go dey, but sacrifice.
Dis dey possible wit mobilisation and di right message.
Befor di election, di movement or party need take detail inventory of di state and design comprehensive action plan wit specific targets wey dey measurable .
Operational guidelines go dey for all appointees plus di governor, and dem go need announce am so every citizen go fit know and challenge, if dem no follow am.
Anybodi wey dey find position inside di movement or party, go begin from di lowest level to di highest.
Som pipo go argue say dis strategy go kill ambition.
Wetin we need now no be ambition but sustainable system wey dey in kontrol of di pipo.
Also, make dem no give anybodi any position unless e don fulfil som basic condition of competence and honesty, and e go bring reference and guarantor.
All public officers must declare dia asset publicly, and dia family members own join, immediately dem reach office. And forensic experts go need verify everytin .
From time to time, di public need dey know dia salary and expenses (plus travel, entertainment etc).
Anybodi wey becom governor or reach any position no go ever do tins on e own. 
Di governor no go ever
Make appointment alone.
Criteria, go dey, dem go need set expectation or target for dose kind appointment, and dem go need dey assess and evaluate am from time to time. 
All contract wey dem go award go dey fair and transparent, and expert inside and outside di government bureaucracy must evaluate am.
Allocation of plots must dey transparent too.
No governor go get total kontrol of di treasury and na competent staff go dey in charge .
Di governor go be di leader wey go guide all di institution to develop and end one-man rule.
If di governor dey free from dis prison of power, e go lead di state to greatness.
E go lead by example and corruption go reduce becos dem don block all di way wey e fit use abuse power.
Governor suppose dey to supervise public servants and make sure say everybodi do im duty well.
E suppose inspire im pipo wit good lifestyle, commitment to service and transparency.
By Ibrahim Ado-Kurawa, di Editor,
Nigeria Year Book and Who is Who
Niger republic and 6 oda kontries don lose di right to vote for UNGA -Guterres
UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres don tok say Niger and six oda nations don lose dia right to vote for di United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), sake of say dem neva pay dia dues.
Di oda kontris wey lose dia UNGA votin right na; Iran, Libya, di Central African Republic, Congo Brazzaville, South Sudan and Zimbabwe, di Jerusalem Post report on Tuesday.
Three more kontris  Comoros, Sao Tome and Principe and Somalia  go get di chance to kontinue to vote, even say dem no pay dia dues too, but sake of say dem show say dem no get di capacity to pay.
Guterres write letter give di General Assembly President, Volkan Bozkir of Turkey say dem go suspend di UNGA votin right of kontris wey dey owe di UN, accordin to di UN Charter.
Di Charter tok say make dem suspend di votin right, if one member state no pay im fees for more dan two years.
Inside di article, a member-state wey owe dues wey dey equal or pass di amount of im contribution for two years fit lose im vote for di General Assembly.
Iran dey owe 16.2 million dollars, money wey pass any oda kontri own.
Meanwhile, Iran don blame U.S, say na dia sanctions no make di Islamic Republic pay im contribution to di UN.
Iran Foreign Ministry tok-tok pesin, Saeed Khatibzadeh yarn say di money wey dem wan use pay UN dey frozen for two South Korean banks, sake of U.S. sanctions.
E tok say di Islamic Republic get a total of USD 7 billion for dose banks, di report tok.
Khatibzadeh tok say make di UN guarantee dem say dem go transfer di payments successfully witout using U.S. banks.
Sake of say di United States don seize Iran international asset befor, di Islamic Republic of Iran don insist say make di UN no use any American bank receive awa kontri membership fee.
As an alternative, dis organization dey guarantee di financial transfer channel, Iran International News quote Khatibzadeh.
BREAKING: Paris Saint-Germain win French Cup
Paris Saint-Germain don win di French Cup as dem beat Monaco 2-0 for Wednesday
final wey dem play for di Stade de France.
Goal wey Mauro Icardi and Kylian Mbappe score won a largely uninspiring final for PSG who now go into the weekends final round of Ligue 1 fixtures with a record-equalling 10th league title still a possibility.
The French champions have now won the French Cup six times in the last seven seasons having reached the final every year since 2015.
It was also the second trophy of coach Mauricio Pochettinos managerial career after he won the Champions Trophy for PSG in January, although this will for many count as his first major honour.
We work every day to experience this kind of feeling, reward and recognition, said Mbappe.
Its the work of a whole group, staff, all the people who work every day for us, the club and of course the supporters who couldnt be there.
We think a lot about the fans and this title is for them as well.
Monaco meanwhile continue their wait to win the French Cup for the first time since 1991, in their first final since 2010 when they were also beaten by PSG.
Niko Kovacs side have however had a positive season and can finish it on a happier note at the weekend by qualifying for the Champions League for the first time since 2018.
Maiden Davnotch Tennis Championship attract 300 players
At least 300 players go participate for di maiden Davnotch National Open Tennis Championship wey go kom up between May 14 and 22 for di tennis court of Moshood Abiola National Stadium wey dey Abuja.
Ifedayo Akindoju, Chairman Caretaker Committee of di Nigeria Tennis Federation (NTF) yarn dis for Abuja on Monday wen e dey follow tori-men tok on di preparations for di championship.
E tok say about N3.5million na im be di prize wey winners of different category go win for di end of di championship.
Akindoju also tok say di championship go serve as di huntin ground for talent wey go dey di national team, to prepare for di plenti international competition wey dey for di federation dis year.
I fit tell you say di winner of di mens singles and di ladies singles go carry N500,000 go house, and for di Wheelchair event (male and female), na N150, 000 each.
Di Wheelchair event no be open event, so na for di top 16 athletes wey dey di ladder.
Recently for Lagos, we host ladder tournament for wheelchair only, so we get di latest ranking of all wheelchair players for Nigeria, and becos say e don end, we get top 16 for men and top 16 for women wey go compete for dis event.
We get di doubles event for di men too; di winner go carry N100,000 go house and dis go be di same tin for di ladies too, Akindoju tok.
As e yarn, di championship dey open for athletes wey be 14 years and above.
Also speakin, Emmanuel Ochei, wey be representative of Davnotch Nigeria Ltd, tok say di company go sponsor di championship as part of im Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and say e no go stop to dey give support for di development of sports.
Di Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) don yarn say e dey consider equity participation for som private refineries wey dey di kontri. 
Di NNPC tok am for one statement on Monday night say di move dey in line wit one Federal Government policy directive, wey tok say di compulsory participation of di Corporation for any privately-owned refinery wey don pass 50,000 barrel per day capacity to keep wit e statutory role of safeguardin national energy security.
Ontop dis one, di Corporation don identify at least six refinery projects wey e won get equity participation. Five of dem dey di development stage, and na Dangote Refinery be di biggest. Di statement yarn.
Di statement by di tok-tok pesin of di Corporation, Dr Kennie Obateru, explain say NNPC National Oil Company of Nigeria get double role; to manage di nation hydrocarbon resources, and to add value to di resources for di benefit of all Nigerians and oda stakeholders.
Dis function dey make am achieve di double objective of providin energy security for di kontri and to stimulate di nation economic development and growth. Obateru yarn.
E tok say NNPC strategic objective to ensure energy security and stimulate economic growth wit limited resources require say make e consider strategic partnership wit competent investors for sectors of di oil and gas value chain especially wia e currently dey operate on sole risk basis.
E add am join say; Di oil refinin sector na one of dose segment wia NNPC dey revisit e strategy, so e go fit strengthen domestic refinin capacity and also guarantee National Energy Security.
E tok am say di new vision na to develop domestic refinin capacity, improve petroleum products supply from awa local refineries and to becom a net exporter of petroleum products.
Di Corporation assure say di move to get equity participation for di private refineries no go reduce di commitment to revive e own refineries and strengthen di domestic refinin sector.
Obateru emphasise am say di main goal na to boost di nation refinin capacity to become a net exporter of petroleum products in di closest possible time and to also boost di nation economy.
Amaechi, Lai Mohammed inspect Lagos-Ibadan rail project in preparation for commissionin.
Di Minista of Transportation, Mr Rotimi Amaechi and im Information and Culture colleague,
Alhaji Lai Mohammed dey inspect di Lagos-Ibadan standard gauge project in preparation for di commissionin by President Muhammadu Buhari.
Daily Trust report say; even say dem neva fix one particular date for di commissionin, dem don plan am to happun for June.
Awa tori-pesin hear say dem fit commission di $1.7bn project wey extend reach di Lagos Ports for Apapa on or befor June 12 to celebrate Democracy Day.
Na why di Ministas dey do anoda inspection to make sure say dem do all di finishin touches wey di project need. 
Daily Trust don tok am befor, how dem don pressure di China Civil Engineering and Construction Corporation (CCECC), di contractor wey dey handle di project, say make dem deliver all di 10 stations before di commissionin.
Di stations na Ebute-Metta, Apapa, Agege, Agbado, Kajola, Papalanto, Abeokuta, Omi Adio, Olodo and Moniya.
Most of di station don almost reach 90 to 100 percent completion stage, and na only finishin touches dem dey do.
Di Ministas, plus di Permanent Secretary of di Ministri of Transport, Dr Magdalene Ajani, Managing Director of di Nigerian Railway Corporation (NRC), Engr Fidet Okhiria and oda officials of di Ministry, begin di inspection from di Mobolaji Johnson Station (Ebute-Metta) befor dem move to di Bola Tinubu Station for Apapa.
Di Ebute-Metta Station na di biggest station for di train corridor.
Di Ministerial team inspect all di convenience facilities, di operational rooms, di nursin room, di waitin areas, and odas. 
Zimbabwe don lose 2 more ministas to COVID-19
Two ministas wey dey serve for di Zimbabwean government don die of di Coronavirus (COVID-19) within few days, and dis don make di kontri announce on Saturday, dia plan to tighten lockdown measures.
Late on Friday, di government announce say Transport Minista, Joel Matiza, don die had afta e fall sick wit COVID-19. Dis na less dan two days afta di kontri lose Foreign minista Sibusiso Moyo to di same disease.
Four government ministas don die for Zimbabwe becos of di coronavirus.
Accordin to som report from di media, plenti oda cabinet ministas dey fight for dia lives for different private hospital.
We dey inside dark cloud wey we need clear veri soon, deputy health minista John Mangwiro tell dpa.
Mangwiro tok dia plans to intensify di current lockdown  and compulsory night curfew, wey don dey since early January.
Dem don force Restaurants, bars and gyms say make dem close.
E add am say; We don see pipo wey no dey obey di lockdown regulations wey dem announce early dis month.
Zimbabwe don register 30,523 case of infection plus 962 deaths since wey di pandemic start.
Di numbers fit dey low if u compare am to oda kontri.
But, di outbreak dey put di nation health system under big pressure.
Zimbabweans don blame President Emmerson Mnangagwa and im predecessor, di late Robert Mugabe, for social media, untop di kontri bad health infrastructure.
Health workers go on strike recently untop di lack of protective equipment and poor salary.
How Kaduna N2tr economy dey struggle wit shutdown
Kaduna state, especially di city witness wetin we fit call major shutdown on Monday wen di Nigerian Labour Congress (NLC) protest di mass sack of workers by di state government.
Pipo get fear say di shutdown wey affect di transport, finance and power sector fit affect di robust economy of di state, wey we feel say e dey part of di top performers for Nigeria.
Accordin to one statistics report by di National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) wey dem release for 2019, as of 2017, Kaduna get nominal Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of N2.69 trillion and dem rank am as di 10th largest economy for Nigeria.
Services and agriculture na im dominate di GDP by N1.37tr.
Howeva, dis services dey affected by di mass shutdown wey happun yesterday, and dem don dey announce am since Sunday.
Accordin to one report by di Oxford Business Group for 2020 , na since 2015 di state don get investment, in excess of $800 million.
Presently, companies don plan to invest about $2.1 billion ova di next two years.
For IGR, di Oxford Business Group report quote wetin Governor Nasir el-Rufai tok say di state double im IGR from N13bn for 2015 to N26bn for 2017.
E still increase to N44bn wit tax, for 2019 afta dem make di tax process simplethroughlegislation.
Daily Trust hear say som of di industry wey dey outside di city centre no dey affected.
Olam Farms wey dey for di outskirt of Kaduna-Abuja road no dey affected becos im staff members dey office yestaday afta di Sallah break
We know about di situation
but u know say we no really dey di city centre
so I no tink say we need boda awasef for now. One senior official tok.
Dem don lose Billions already.
Meanwhile, experts tok am say na billions of naira dem go don lose untop di groundin of businesses for di state.
One former banker and economist tok say dem for don avoid di strike if di state governor don negotiate wit di union.
Na Kaduna Goods wey dey go north dey pass, and from di north, e go pass Kaduna go oda part of Nigeria.
Imagine di loss wey happun becos of di power outage, di logistics, transportation and odas.
Na billions e go be. Imagine di hospitals, hotels, transportation, small businesses wey shut down.
Di economy don crash.
E go increase di veri bad security situation more.
John Okon, wey be anoda analyst yarn say na more dan N50 million dem go don lose for di two days, especially as light no dey, and fuel stations don shut down.
By Chris Agabi, Simon Echewofun Sunday & Hussein Yahaya
Arteta must deliver next season
As I don mention befor, Arsenal no get am for mind to sack Mikel Arteta and di club management go back am to turn di Gunners around next season.
Nobodi dey sure if Arsenal don take di right decision, but di club dey plan bring more talented players dis summer.
Pipo dey ask serious questions about di manager ability, and even e own dressin room players dey look am dey wonder if na im be di right man for di job.
For 39 years, Arteta get reputation, wey e build wit Pep Guardiola, as a brilliant coach.
But, afta seventeen months wey e don dey in charge, di fortune of Arsenal neva improve and plenti pipo go argue say di performance of di team dey low pass wen Unai Emery, di man wey e replace, wey knock am out of Europa League dey dia.
Arteta na captain for Arsenal befor and di fans welcome am as dia new champion. But dem don dey lose patience and dem dey agitated as dem see sayChelsea and Tottenham done move ahead.
Di Super League disaster  no be sometin wey pipo go forget for a long time
but I fit tell u say di Kroenke owners no dey go anywia.
So, e dey Arteta hand to improve tins, build strong team and get im tactics right next season, if not di proud Gunners fit crash and burn.
De Gea no go gree to be No 2
Even say Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea get im contract till 2023, im agent dey test microphone, to see di club wey go wan sign am.
I dey hear for inside Old Trafford say even say e get gud parole wit di current No 1 Dean Henderson, De Gea no go siddun take bench for long.
I dey hear say Atletico Madrid, Paris Saint Germain and Real Madrid get interest.
We no go deny say di 30-year-old dey on top of im career, even say som pipo for inside di club believe say e don drop small for di past two years.
Manager Solskjaer tok say, Goalkeeper departments dey veri tight knit group.
Dem dey work for preparation, dem get different gym session, personal session to di rest of di squad and dem dey stay togeda more.
Naturally dem dey create a bond and di spirit for di goalkeepin department dey high.
Na beta competition.
I am sure the coach is right however if De Gea doesnt regain recognition for the No1 stitched onto the back of his shirt and is left on the bench in crucial games, I am reliably informed he will move out of Old Trafford.
I take West Brom to bounce back yet again
After one season back in the Premier League we again say goodbye to West Bromwich Albion.
The key to yet another quick bounce back from the Championship will be whether or not fire-fighting manager Sam Allardyce can be persuaded to stay.
He is disappointed to have lost his reputation as never having been relegated with any club and the board at West Brom have a lot of work to do if they want to keep him.
Ainsley Maitland-Niles, Conor Gallagher and Okay Yokuslu will return to their parent clubs after being on loan but Matheus Pereira, Callum Robinson, Hal Robson-Kanu and Karlan Grant can impress in the lower league.
Who is the fastest player in the Manchester City squad?
No, it isnt Raheem Sterling.
Manager Pep Guardiola set up a practice whereby each player had to control the ball and sprint 10 yards.
There are some very fast movers in the City squad but Gabriel Jesus proved he was the fastest.
The best is yet to come from Havertz
Thomas Tuchel has been singing the praises of Kai Havertz and pointed to his two goals recently scored against Fulham.
Tuchel recognises that since Kai arrived at Stamford Bridge from Bayer Leverkusen, things have not gone well for the German.
Moving from a foreign country and having to handle lockdown restrictions made things difficult and of course he caught Covid-19 and had to battle back to fitness.
If they do not win their next game, Sheffield United will become the first team since the 1904-05 season to have gone without winning two consecutive games.
Kane is keen to move on from his boyhood club after Tottenham also missed out on the Champions League for a second straight year.
Chairman for di economic and financial crimes commission (EFCC) Abdulrasheed Bawa don make declaration say dem go resuscitate di Bank Employees Assets Declaration Act of 1986 to block loopholes wey bankers don create to sanitise di kontri's financial system
According to wetin Bawa tok, dem take di decision due to di role wey dem dey expect make bankers play for di fight against corruption, as di EFCC don mandate am to ensure say dem comply wit di Act.
Section 1 for di Bank Employees Declaration of Assets Act 1986 don make am mandatory for Evri employee for di bank to make full disclosure of assets upon employment for annual basis.
Di law wey dey under Section 7 Sub-Section 1 stipulates say na offence e go be for an employee of a bank make e own assets in excess of dia legitimate and probable income
Afta di EFCC chairman don stipulate di deadline, consequences go arise as a result of non-declaration by bank employees
Spelt out penealty of 10 years inprisonment upon conviction as well as forfeiture of assets wey dey beyond and above legitimate income and probable earnings for dat kain bank employees.
Dis piece of legislature don dey so tey 1986 under di military
So tey, dis part of di constitution don dey ineeffective by those wey suppose dey implement am ordinarily
Bankers don aware of dis legislation but di level wey dem dey comply no dey encouraging
For di 80s, dem dey hand form to bankers wey dem go complete and submit
But as e dey go for awa kontri, dem don abandon di implementation of dat provision for di law , and dem no longer consideram as a fundamental part for di banking profession.
Stakeholders dey blame di failure on top di authorities wey include di CBN, Chartered Institute of Bank of Naija (CIBN) and Bankers Committee for some kain abnormalities wey dey di industry.
According to wetin dem dey tok, dem say diz regulators dey rely on di bank wey dem suppose supervise, make e supply information
For instance, dem don argue am say di failed banks episode apun some months afta dem give di regulator for diz banks clean bill of health
Dis suggest say dem don doctor di information wey di bank supplied
Naija don dey battle case like corruption and money laundering and dem dey accuse bankers and banking officials say dem be part of it
Some moni don remain redundant for plenti accounts bikos some account owners don kpeme which some bank officials go convert to dia own as dem go leave families of di account owners for penury.
Dis dey in spite of di fact say di banking sector no strange to self-regulation,given its tempting, delicate and di operating system wey dey fragile
Di CIBN Act of 2007 don dey regulate di banking system
E get code of conduct wey bankers don agree pon wit CBN
Disciplinary tribunal wey get power for di high court dey and e dey ensure say dem bring reported infractions, unethical conduct and indiscipline before di tribunal, and sanctions wey dem recommended for formal prosecution.
But one of di challenges be di weak reporting system wey bankers get wey dey lead to di inability of CIBN make dem take appropriate actions.
Di spirit wey stan gidigba for di back of di Act of 1986 na to make clear, di financial standing wey bank employee get for di time of employment, and afta years of service, in a bid wey go make dem ascertain say dem dey commensurate dia legitimate earnings wit dia lifestyles wey dey current
Na dis dey kom on top di heels of allegation say some bankers be direct beneficiaries for fraudulent transactions wey dem dey carry out for di bank
Wetin be common knowledge be say di declaration of assests by public officers wey include di civil servants, pesin wey dey politically exposed and those wey dey for di Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs).
Dem require dem make dem declare dia assets evri four years
On top di election and appointment of political office holders, before dem assume office dem suppose declare di assets wey dey get pon entry kom declare am again for di exit point
Dem do dis declaration by oath
For anoda word, execution and attestation before di high court or some oda superior officer for di law dey
Di Naija customs service (NCS), Naija Immigration Service (NIS), among odas, dem don covered by di Code of Conduct Act wit regard to di declaration of dia assets.
As e dey so finacial experts believe say di impression wey di directive to bankers create make dem comply wit di of legislation wey dey pre-exist dey amount to stigmatisation and e dey also isolates bank employees, wey dey puts dem in di limelight.
In oda words, d belief of revisiting of di Act of 1986 dey encourage di policy of isolation wey dey kos apprehension in di industry.
Dis na di concern say di Act fit kos enrolment into di banking profession to further go down as a result of stigmatisation.
Some stakeholders don caution against di drama about stigmatisation, arguing say plenti bankers, from di highest cadre to di level wey low pass, dey live above dia means.
According to wetin dem tok , an average banker even from dia early point of calling, dey cut corners by conniving wit customers say dem go beat di system.
Dem insist say for evri major corruption, banker wey dey facilitate di transaction dey
E dey laudible say di EFCC dey try use di Act for reason wey good
Di worry be say di banks wey di goment no own per se although di goverment get shares in dem
Dem dey use bank save moni
Di koko be say laws wey dey check illicit enrichment dey
Article 20 for di UN Convention Against Corruption dey explicit on top dis
Section 7 for di EFCC act don empower EFCC make e dey investigate pesin wey hin lifestyle no commensurate wit di means of income wey dem get
Dem believe am for some part say di politically exposed person dey plunder di assests for dis kontri plenti of dem dey untouchable
Dem accuse EFCC say e no fair and even-handed
If dem sanitise di banking sector, we go get ripple effect for oda sectors of di economy
Dem take all diz measure to strengden di fight against corruption, and not to stigmatise di banking profession or portray it as di scapegoat wey dey witin di system.
Besides, di banking career no be one kain rouguish profession
Some bankers be di forefront of exposing some of di mega corruption issues wey wedon see di EFCC making headway.
Part of why dis law dey be say e dey ensure make di kontri dey free from financial crimes, and make e dey also block loopholes wey unscrupulous players dey esploit
While dem dey hope say make di Act of 1986 na sincere attempt at sanitising di system , dem suppose create platform wey go report thresholds of deposits on a daily basis, and di regulator suppose dey able to access it to know di declarations wey dem make.
E dey make am easy reference to wetin dem don declare as legitimate income to check those wey dey live above dia means
Moses Amadi wey be researcher na hin send dis piece from Lagos
Houserent don due and I no get moni/shingbain wey I go give di landlord
Vigilante tok say na mistake hin use kill passerby but na robbery suspect be my target
One 30-year-old member of a local vigilante , Lukma Rasak wey dem arrest for kilin a passerby for Ijora wey be a Lagos suburb, say na mistake.
Dem allege di suspect say hin shoot one 28-year-old man, Musa Yahaya , for di area
Di suspect wey dem allege don flee commot for scene of di crime afta hin don realise hin mistake
Policemen track am down to wia hin dey hide wey dey attached to Ijora police station , Lagos state police command
Muyiwa Adejobi wey be Lagos State tok tok pesin don yarn for one statement wey dem issues for Wednesday night say di crime occur for di early hours for Tuesday, April 13 2021
Adejobi yarn say dem eventually arrest di suspect about 2pm afta dem rush di victim go hospital kom confirm am say hin don kpeme
Hin say detectives track di suspect go hin hiding place, wia dem arrest am and hin gun and some catridge wey dem recovered

Constitutuion review; Senate don hold public hearing for 12 states
Di senate constitution review don tok am say di zonal public hearing on di review two public hearings per geopolitical zone.
Di event wey go simultaenously across 12 states for Naija go witness two public hearings per geopolitical zone.
Also a national public hearing suppose hold for Abuja wey be di nation a capital
Chairman, Senate Committee on Constitution Review and Deputy President of di Senate, Senator Ovie Omo-Agege disclose am yesterday for Abuja
Speaking as hin dey host members of di legal defence and assistance projrct (LEPAD) for hin office wey na National Coordinator, Chino Obiagwu (SAN)lead am , Senator Omo-Agege called on those wey don already submit memeoranda to speak for di event
Dem dance taya for di carnival
According to wetin hin tok , di South East go hold di hearing for Owerri and Enugu , while di South South and South West go do am for Port Harcourt and Asaba as well as Akure and Lagos respectively.

Rabbit farming don boom for plateau
Di secretary, Plateau Rabbit Breeders Association, Mr Pam Gyang tok say rabbit farming don bikom popular for di state wit plenti residents engaging in it.
Gyang tok am for an interview wit di News Agency of Naija on Tuesday for Jos, say e don bikom a household business just like poultry farming.
Gyang tok say plenti trainnig outfits wey dey involved for di breeding and selling of live rabbit don spring up across di state.
Di secretary tok say rabbit rearing na lucrative business wey fit increase pesin income and impact positively on di economy.
Hin tok say rabbits dey highly fertile and farmers dey sell according to dia weight as e dey range from N1,800 to N5,000 or even more
Hin tok say for di lockdown wey COVID-19 occassioned families dey kom farm kom request for rabbits cages and rabbits to startup farms for dia backyards.
Hin say di high demand for rabbits meat so tey di numerous health benefit over red meat don arouse di interest of plenti farmers.
Gyang say di get low mortality rate and e require minimal handling adding say plenti pipo don invest in rearing dem so e go meet international market standard.
Hin say, awa rabbit meat don go as far as London and we go still export dem weneva dem demand for dem
Hin tok am say farmers dey generate resources from di sale of di hide and skin of rabbit for textile industries and hin faeces na source of fertilizer.

My name na Thomas Favor
Aero don follow Abuja-Bauchi expand flight
Naijas oldest airline wey old pass don conclude for an arrangement say dem go commence flights from Abuja to Bauchi four times weekly beginning from Wednesday as part of its route expansion programme.
According to di airline say dem go follow di Bauchi flight closely by those of Maiaduguri wey dey Borno state and Calabar wey dey Cross River on dates wey dem go announce soon
Di managing Director for di Aero, Capt Abdullahi Mahmood don tok am for one conference for Lagos say Dem go dey operate di Abuja-Bauchi flights Evri Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday.
According to wetin dem schedule, di Bauchi flight go depart Abuja at 09:10am and e go arrive for Bauchi at 10:10 am.
Di return leg do depart Bauchi for 10:40 and e go arrive for Abuja at 11:40 for weekdays , while for Sunday di flight go commot Abuja for Bauchi at 09:50 am, wit di return flight from Bauchi at 11:20 am.
Di MD don explain say di passengers wey dey kom from Lagos fit fly to Bauchi via Abuja using di di 06:45 am flight wey dey commot Lagos.
I go sing for my life
Bauchi and Maiduguri na some of di undeserving cities for di Northern Naija
Hin add am say na airlines Boeing 737-400 wey dem just release from C-Check conduct for di Aero maintenance hangar go be di one wey dem go use for di new routes
